\xe6\xad\x8c\xe6\x89\x8b/\xe5\x88\xb6\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xba\xba \xe8\x8c\x83\xe6\x99\x93\xe8\x90\xb1<br>\xe3\x80\x8c\xe7\xac\xac\xe4\xba\x8c\xe6\xac\xa1\xe5\x88\xb6\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe6\x8b\x89\xe6\x8b\x89\xe7\x9a\x84\xe4\xb8\x93\xe8\xbe\x91\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xad\xa6\xe4\xb9\xa0\xe5\x8a\x9b\xe6\x97\xba\xe7\x9b\x9b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xaf\xb9\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe4\xb9\x90\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x8e\x8c\xe6\x8f\xa1\xe6\x9b\xb4\xe7\x94\xb1\xe6\xb8\xb8\xe5\x88\x83\xe6\x9c\x89\xe4\xbd\x99\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x83\x8a\xe5\x96\x9c\xe6\x96\xbc\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x88\x90\xe7\x86\x9f\xe5\xba\xa6\xe8\x83\x9c\xe6\x96\xbc\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe5\xbe\x80\xe3\x80\x82\xe5\x85\xb7\xe6\x9c\x89\xe5\x88\xb6\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\xbd\x9c\xe5\x8a\x9b\xe3\x80\x82\xe3\x80\x8d~~~\xe5\x88\xb6\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xba\xba \xe9\x99\x88\xe5\xbb\xba\xe9\xaa\x90<br>\xe3\x80\x8c\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe4\xb9\x90\xe6\x97\xb6\xe8\x80\x8c\xe7\xbc\xa9\xe5\xbe\x97\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xb0\x8f\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\xbb\x86\xe8\x85\xbb\xe5\x86\x85\xe6\x95\x9b\xe5\x9c\xb0\xe9\xa3\x98\xe6\x95\xa3\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe7\xa9\xba\xe6\xb0\x94\xe9\x87\x8c\xe3\x80\x81\xe6\xb5\x81\xe5\x8a\xa8\xe5\x88\xb0\xe8\xa1\x80\xe6\xb6\xb2\xe9\x87\x8c\xe3\x80\x82\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe4\xb9\x90\xe6\x97\xb6\xe8\x80\x8c\xe5\x8f\x98\xe5\xbe\x97\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xae\xbd\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xae\xbd\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\x87\xaa\xe7\x94\xb1\xe5\xa5\x94\xe6\x94\xbe\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe5\x83\x8f\xe8\xb6\xb3\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe5\xa1\x9e\xe8\xbf\x9b\xe4\xb8\x80\xe6\x95\xb4\xe4\xb8\xaa\xe4\xb8\x96\xe7\x95\x8c\xe3\x80\x82\xe3\x80\x8d~~~\xe5\x88\x9b\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xba\xba \xe8\x91\x9b\xe5\xa4\xa7\xe4\xb8\xba<br>\xe8\xbf\x99\xe4\xb8\xaa\xe5\x94\xb1\xe8\x91\x97\xe8\xba\xab\xe9\xaa\x91\xe7\x99\xbd\xe9\xa9\xac\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xa5\xb3\xe5\xad\xa9\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\xbb\x8f\xe5\x8e\x86\xe4\xba\x86\xe6\x8c\xab\xe8\xb4\xa5\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xbd\x93\xe4\xbc\x9a\xe4\xba\x86\xe6\x88\x90\xe9\x95\xbf\xef\xbc\x8c<br>\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe8\x90\xbd\xe6\xb3\xaa\xe3\x80\x81\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe5\xa4\xb1\xe6\x9c\x9b\xe3\x80\x81\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe5\xad\xa4\xe5\x8d\x95\xe3\x80\x81\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe7\x9b\xbc\xe6\x9c\x9b\xef\xbc\x8c<br>\xe8\xb0\x81\xe5\x8f\x88\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe6\x98\xaf\xe8\xbf\x99\xe6\xa0\xb7\xe5\xad\x90\xe8\xb5\xb0\xe8\xbf\x87\xe6\x9d\xa5\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x85\xb3\xe5\x8f\x88\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x85\xb3\xe2\x80\xa6<br>\xe8\xae\xbe\xe7\xab\x8b\xe5\x81\x9c\xe6\x8d\x9f\xe7\x82\xb9\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x8c\x91\xe6\x88\x98\xe6\x9e\x81\xe9\x99\x90\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\x9c\x8b\xe8\xa7\x81\xe6\x9b\xb4\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe6\x9b\xb4\xe5\x8b\x87\xe6\x95\xa2\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xef\xbc\x81<br>10\xe9\xa6\x96\xe9\xa2\x86\xe6\x82\x9f\xe7\x94\x9f\xe5\x91\xbd\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\xb7\xac\xe7\x82\xbc\xe4\xb9\x8b\xe4\xbd\x9c \xe5\xbe\x90\xe4\xbd\xb3\xe8\x8e\xb9 \xe7\xac\xac2\xe5\xbc\xa0\xe5\x88\x9b\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xb8\x93\xe8\xbe\x91 [\xe6\x9e\x81\xe9\x99\x90]<br>8/16 \xe5\xbc\x80\xe5\xa7\x8b\xe9\xa2\x84\xe8\xb4\xad 9/3 \xe6\xad\xa3\xe5\xbc\x8f\xe5\x8f\x91\xe8\xa1\x8c<br>\xe9\xa2\x84\xe8\xb4\xad\xe8\xb5\xa0\xe5\x93\x81: \xe3\x80\x8aMy dear friend \xe6\x8b\x89\xe6\x8b\x89\xe6\x83\xb3\xe8\xa6\x81\xe8\xaf\xb4\xe3\x80\x8b\xe8\xb4\xb4\xe5\xbf\x83\xe5\x8d\xa1\xe7\x89\x87<br>2009\xe5\xb9\xb4\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xbe\x90\xe4\xbd\xb3\xe8\x8e\xb9\xe5\x8f\x91\xe8\xa1\x8c\xe7\xac\xac\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\xbc\xa0\xe5\x88\x9b\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xb8\x93\xe8\xbe\x91\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe8\xbf\x99\xe5\xbc\xa0\xe4\xb8\x93\xe8\xbe\x91\xe4\xb8\xba\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe5\xb9\xb3\xe5\x87\xa1\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x88\x9b\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe7\x94\x9f\xe5\x91\xbd\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\x86\x99\xe4\xb8\x8b\xe4\xb8\x80\xe9\xa1\xb5\xe5\xb4\xad\xe6\x96\xb0\xe4\xb9\x90\xe7\xab\xa0\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\x90\x8c\xe6\x97\xb6\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe4\xb8\xba\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe5\xb8\xa6\xe6\x9d\xa5\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x8d\xa3\xe8\x80\x80\xe4\xb8\x8e\xe5\x85\xb3\xe6\xb3\xa8\xe3\x80\x82\xe5\xbd\x93\xe9\x82\xa3\xe4\xba\x9b\xe6\xbb\xa1\xe8\xbd\xbd\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\xb5\x9e\xe8\xb5\x8f\xe4\xb8\x8e\xe6\x9c\x9f\xe8\xae\xb8\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\x9b\xb8\xe7\xbb\xa7\xe5\x87\xba\xe7\x8e\xb0\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe8\xbf\x99\xe5\x8d\x95\xe7\xba\xaf\xe5\xa5\xb3\xe7\x94\x9f\xe7\x9a\x84\xe7\x94\x9f\xe5\x91\xbd\xe9\xa3\x8e\xe6\x99\xaf\xe6\x97\xb6\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe8\xaf\xa5\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe6\x81\x8b\xe6\xa0\x88\xe5\x9c\xb0\xe5\xb0\x86\xe4\xb9\x8b\xe8\xa7\x86\xe4\xb8\xba\xe8\xbf\x87\xe7\x9c\xbc\xe8\xb7\xaf\xe6\xa0\x87\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x88\x96\xe8\x80\x85\xe8\xaf\xa5\xe6\x88\x92\xe6\x85\x8e\xe6\x83\xb6\xe6\x81\x90\xe5\x9c\xb0\xe6\x8a\x8a\xe6\x89\x80\xe6\x9c\x89\xe6\x84\x8f\xe5\xa4\x96\xe5\xbd\x93\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe6\x98\xaf\xe6\x9c\xaa\xe6\x9d\xa5\xe8\xb7\xaf\xe9\x80\x94\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x8c\x87\xe5\xbc\x95?<br>\xe4\xbb\x8e\xe6\xad\x8c\xe5\x94\xb1\xe6\xaf\x94\xe8\xb5\x9b\xe6\x80\xbb\xe5\x86\xa0\xe5\x86\x9b\xe3\x80\x81\xe5\xbc\x95\xe5\x8f\x91\xe5\x85\xa8\xe5\x8f\xb0\xe7\x9a\x84[\xe8\xba\xab\xe9\xaa\x91\xe7\x99\xbd\xe9\xa9\xac]\xe6\x95\x88\xe5\xba\x94\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\x86\x8d\xe5\x88\xb0\xe9\x87\x91\xe6\x9b\xb2\xe5\xa5\x96\xe6\x9c\x80\xe4\xbd\xb3\xe6\x96\xb0\xe4\xba\xba\ "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (DUO 陈奕迅2010演唱会, 陈奕迅DUO 演唱会3CD<br>逾160分钟倾力演出<br>实力演绎: 好歌献给你/ 约定/ 囍帖街/<br>禁色/ 破晓/ 热辣辣/ 反斗星/<br>头发乱了/ 好戏在後头/ 芳华绝代<br>特别献唱: 日文版 Mr.Lonely<br>2010年，陈奕迅突破个人演唱会场数的纪录，于3月20日至4月6日香港红馆举行一连18场《DUO 陈奕迅2010演唱会》。为配合「DUO 双面」主题，在歌曲和造型上大玩 crossover。Eason 穿上半黑半白的造型出场，在齿轮为背景的舞台上大唱出「今天等我来」。选曲上亦作出突破，近40首歌曲中，几乎唱了三分之一其他歌手的名作，如「好歌献给你」、「囍帖街」、「约定」、「寂寞夜晚」、「破晓」等，歌者再把他自己的歌曲配上意境和故事，同时以《Time files》的妖冶造型现身，重新诠释和连接「DUO」的演唱会概念。<br>至于快歌的组曲， Eason 在「无人之境」先後与女舞蹈员拥吻，并在 medley 中选唱了多首前辈的代表歌，张国荣的「热辣辣」、谭咏麟的「反斗星」、草蜢的「好戏在後头」、张学友的「头发乱了」，同时一人分饰两角，挑战模仿梅艳芳和张国荣的「芳华绝代」，呈现一体二面的双重性格，惹来全场观众惊叫不已。演唱会中，Eason 不忘扮鬼扮马，在台上大玩不文又讲烂Gag搞气氛，亦特别演唱玉置浩二的「Mr. Lonely」，向父亲送上「单车」。尽管 Eason 的声音带些沙哑，但愈唱愈好，完场时向歌迷多次安哥，为《DUO2010演唱会》划上了圆满句号, upload/1335970847.09.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 陳奕迅, 2010, 310, 0602488992695, Cinepoly, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['DUO "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Some Kind of Trouble, 《Some Kind of Trouble》是英国抒情摇滚创作歌手James Blunt的第三张个人专辑，计划将于2010年11月8日于英国发行。新专集的首支主打单曲“Stay the Night”已经在2010年10月25日面世。这张专辑是James Blunt在洛杉矶的某私人录音室录制的。专辑将会有两个版本——标准版和豪华版。豪华版为Play.com独家发行，将收录特别的专辑封套以及有 James Blunt亲笔签名的专辑封面。James Blunt将在2011年开始全新巡演，来宣传这张专辑。<br>在一次与Contact Music的访谈中，Blunt是这样描述这张专辑的：“最近一次巡演结束之后，我一直试图靠弹钢琴来写歌，但是我发现我不断地在重复自己，写的都是些关于我这个潦倒老人的伤心歌。我需要远离音乐一段时间。我的新歌更加乐观。”他还说：“这些年来，我深深领会到这样一个道理，一旦你的唱片大卖之后，其中的艺术气息也就不再重要了。‘You're Beautiful’对我来说有特殊的意义，但对多数人而言，这不过是一首供他们借酒消愁的歌。” (中文简介来自UKoO), upload/1335970849.1.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, James Blunt, 2010, 312, 0075678893018, Atlantic, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['Some "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (P.S. 是的，我在台北。, 台北这座城市，宛如庞然巨树，<br>她呼吸，他存在。她是生活，他是享受。<br>我们感受 世界可大可小可有可无，<br>故事走路的脚步可前可后可左可右可空白。<br>歌曲推荐<br>{ 妹妹 } 你你 / 他她都爱过的故事，在一个安静的台北夜里。<br>你问我说 / 爱到底是什么 / 台北的夜变得很沉默<br>我们游走，又停留，直到确定留下什么，才离开。<br>久违纯粹的升式情歌 ｛妹妹｝ 徘徊无解的爱情角力 该用多少力气<br>她是男人内心美丽的哀愁 她是女人沈去却旧不了的回忆<br>关于情歌，我们都没有把握。<br>{妹妹} MV特地请来好友周格泰掌镜，拍摄事前的沟通会议如升哥往常的随性气氛，甚至最后底定主打歌为{妹妹}居然是导演决定的！MV内容秉持有点八卦又不是那么真实的铁汉柔情，集结过去曾和升哥传过绯闻的MV女主角片段，让观众看得有点快乐又有点享受，有点可爱又有点可恶。<br>{ 二丶十年以前} 在台北的生活，永远不缺故事。P.S. 不管经过了多少年。<br>转眼之间我们到了另一个路口，<br>有机会的时候告诉我，<br>二丶十年前和那时之后的现在，还有不久的以后，我们如何的改变和不变。<br>P.S. 你好吗？<br>不管已经过了多少二丶十年，陈升的故事是永远无法轻易划上句点的。<br>就像关于人的记忆，回忆和想象，总是在碰到某个事物景色，水龙头就哗啦啦的被打开了。从来也没想过要到达的是怎样的风景，因为总在路上就贪玩起来。<br>｛二十岁的眼泪\｝是陈升为金城武写的歌；｛路口｝是陈升和金城武的合作；{Twenty years ago} 是陈升钟爱的一首西洋老歌，当时为杨林制作翻唱，涌现想起的有如红酒的醇厚香气，沈醉略带默然涩味的微醺。庆幸我们的美好时代的香醇，足以留下踱步于每个二丶十年，没有终点。<br>｛来去厦门电头毛｝台商男人到大陆，女人啊美人啊当自强！来去厦门街电头毛！<br>新宝岛的灵魂，陈升的笔记诗。<br>姥姥说啊说啊，陈升说啊唱啊。<br>这是一个家里有台商就有可能发生的故事，而它也真的发生了，就在升哥周遭朋友身上。歌里上演人性肥皂剧，打开窗户剧本可能随时就会被丢进来！不一定每个人都有兴趣，但有兴趣的人铁定多了一份柔情。, 2012-05-02 23:01:07,043 INFO 1335970867.04.jpg封面下载成功
2012-05-02 23:01:07,045 INFO 开始添加
2012-05-02 23:01:07,071 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (志明与春娇, 《志明与春娇》，彭浩翔不讳言灵感是来自他与妻子最爱的五月天同名歌曲。1999年，五月天的阿信写出这对怨侣，十多年后竟成为了彭导与编剧麦曦茵笔下的烟民调情七步曲。杨千嬅扮演的Sephora化妆小姐『余春娇』与余文乐的广告公司职员『张志明』，烟铲一族，无烟不欢，电影把2007年香港开始实施室内全面禁烟来写这对男女—志明与春娇，因禁烟在后巷抽烟的邂逅。然而，电影配音绝不港式地道，用古巴音乐、圚舞曲和法式风情来调配这段错摸不定的七日情，令烟叶烟絮之间透出澹澹的格调。<br>《志明与春娇》的电影音乐再次由曾担当《公主复仇记》和《AV》配乐的翁玮盈与黄艾伦再次操刀。<br>如果香港烟民占整体人口约15%，即有超过一百万的烟民需要Smoke Break，他们可能像志明与春娇等人一样『蛇王』，走到街上围着垃圾筒『打边炉』，蹲在后巷吞云吐雾。在黄簧管「好地方」的伴奏下，估不到肮脏且狭窄的后巷抽烟变成了浪漫主义，志明主动上前为春娇点烟，互相试探。镜头一转，配乐变成时尚的法式情怀，本来「法兰西」的浪漫钢琴声，估不到彭导幽观众一默，画面上众人在红酒与鹅肝把酒言欢，镜头下却无限放大志明被女友出卖的黄色故事。<br>「Why couldn´t be together everyday?」是电影的主题音乐，Slow Bossa与女声(翁玮盈) "da la da la" 的忐忑吟诵，吉他拨奏下就是志明与春娇的恋爱预告。再扬起即兴的吉他曲「法国人惹的祸」，再由春娇在卡拉OK扮娜姐一夜间高唱甄妮的「最后的玫瑰」，速成她与志明的一拍即合，两人互发短讯来往，他们就是这样暧昧地开始。「Can´t stop smoking」不间断的三拍子旋律，就像烟圈的咒箍紧，港男港女两性间成为了永远的矛盾。在香港政府宣布加烟税的午夜前，上瘾难戒的志明与春娇，忽忙找烟，再在便利店相遇，从小提琴、钢琴的跳跃二重奏「Swing Swing」，究竟他们在『爱情抛锚』找到什么的答桉，由欧式手风琴调出的Dark Slow Waltz调子「Transparent Secret」带出的谜底，就隐藏于出人意表的弦乐「n55IWI」之中。<br>充满了鬼主义的彭浩翔，创作的故事有不少黑色幽默、恐怖、离奇荒诞甚至男女情欲等元素。彭浩翔的电影，不止是光怪陆离，本身非烟民的他连拍『食支烟』也别有洞天的男女恋爱观点。片中虽然没有用上的怀旧复式二拍子「春天」和『超级巨声』的邝栢廉唱出的「如烟」，接上了这对抽『绿 Luck』与『幼卡碧』—「Dream Smoker」大团圆的心声，幸好特别收录在这张电影原声大碟之内。, upload/1335970867.04.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 黄艾伦, 2010, 310, 4897013003762, 东亚唱片(集团)有限公司, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); Ong<br>在臺首張英文大碟「Olivia」<br>傳奇紀錄<br>＊ 2005年在日本發行了首張個人專輯《A Girl Meets Bossanova》成為首位成功打入日本市場的新加坡歌手，日本樂迷票選十年來最令人心醉Bossanova專輯<br>＊ 被譽為媲美小野麗莎的巴莎女伶，出道以來的所有作品都在 HMV拿到83分以上的極高評價，發燒迷樂友最擁戴的美聲小天后<br>＊ 2008年首支中文單曲「如燕」於新加坡933電臺獲得當週第二名的強勢成績，并登上新加坡網路下載排行榜冠軍<br>美聲收錄<br>＊ 超級星光大道評審觀眾口碑肯定一戰成名曲- 「Ain’t No Sunshine」<br>魔王級溫柔美聲完整收錄 深刻感人再次來襲<br>＊ 重新詮釋世紀天團The Beatles「Here,There and Everywhere」、英倫靈魂樂領航樂團Simply Red「Stars」，經典歌曲 溫暖再現，忠實樂迷不可能錯過<br>＊ 個性演譯七○年代~八○年代女聲金曲「I Feel The Earth Move」、「Luka」<br>九○年代甜美女聲 隔空致敬 勾起中生代族群的世代記憶<br>＊ 首波主打歌詞創作「You and Me」、詞曲創作「Bittersweet」<br>展現創作才華 最能代表Olivia的全新英文專輯<br>＊ 超偶評審王治平制作 2012-05-02 23:01:23,250 DEBUG (0.003) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Private Corner, 2008年初张学友完成了105场《学友光年世界巡回演唱会》后， 2009年他参与了《月满轩尼诗》、《全城热恋》和《72家租客》等多部电影演出。 2010年，终于让我们等到他，张学友全新粤语大碟「Private Corner」。<br>距离上一张粤语专辑已经超过五年的时间，张学友终于再次推出全新粤语大碟「Private Corner」专辑共收录9首全新粤语新歌加1首英文新单曲。出道超过25年，发行超过70张专辑，曾创下华语乐坛无数奇迹的张学友，永远不停地在追求不同的成就与进步，但唱歌始终是他的最爱。尽管现今大环境不断改变，音乐潮流也变化无穷，但学友清楚知道自己的方向，不会盲目地追随，制作专辑时反而能抛开市场压力与商业考量，回归到最基本的音乐本质与聆听性。近一年的筹备，学友终于交出一张连自己都很喜欢听的音乐作品。这次专辑制作人学友找来他音乐老搭档，也曾多次担任他演唱会音乐总监的杜自持共同合作。专辑品质除了有学友一贯的坚持与要求，为再提升音乐的聆听享受，学友首次采用发烧级的TARA LABS铜线录音，而顶尖乐手们能齐聚录音室共同演奏的自由即兴与灵活互动，更是在现今的唱片制作里难得一见，高规格的要求让声线与音质都展现出超高的纯度与生命力。毫无疑问，张学友的完美靓声再一次征服我们的听觉品味，更满足了发烧友挑剔的耳朵。<br>现代人常埋首于工作之中或忙碌于生活之际，总渴望能拥有属于自己的「 Private Corner」。在这里可以抛开一切的压力与烦扰，放下紧绷的情绪，喝杯咖啡或啜饮着酒，沈浸在醉人的音乐氛围中，有如老朋友般的亲切陪伴，慢慢的聆听，平静而温暖。这是一种享受，是一种品味，更是一种上瘾的滋味。专辑筹备初期，学友就有「Private Corner 」这概念，既然是「Private」就决定要做一张最贴近自己的音乐。专辑里所选的每一首歌都是学友自己很钟意听的音乐类型，但过往专辑却鲜有机会唱的。录制完成后学友曾边开车边听这张专辑，听到他宁愿绕远路走也不想把音乐从中暂停。这就是「Private Corner 」的无形魅力，一听就会上瘾。专辑设计简约而华丽，呈现学友低调的完美主义，产品没有多余累赘的包装，却有发烧级的聆听享受。专辑封面与内页照片，在奚仲文的美术指导下，透过夏永康的镜头捕捉，以简单的线条、单纯的色系勾勒出学友成熟男人的沈稳内敛与时尚品味。, upload/1335970883.23.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 张学友, 2010, 17, 0602488990578, 正东唱片, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['Private Corner', 2012-05-02 23:01:25,608 DEBUG (0.010) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Speak Now, 4座葛莱美得主、2008与2009全美年度专辑销售最高歌手－「国民小公主」泰勒丝(Taylor Swift)，将于10月25日发行她的第三张大碟【Speak Now】，新歌”我的最爱Mine(暂译)”原订美国在8月16日于电台首播并同步数位发行，却于8月3日就在网络上提前外流，唱片公司临时决定提前12天在8月4日发行，虽然宣传计划因此被打乱，但在美国拥有庞大歌迷的泰勒丝，新歌只发行四天就创下29万7千次付费下载，空降告示牌数位榜冠军与单曲榜第3名，也让泰勒丝成为在一年之内拥有两首空降单曲榜前五名的女歌手，追平玛丽亚凯莉在1995年创下的纪录。这首新歌将于今天(8/16)下午2点在飞碟电台首播，台湾数字音乐平台也会在今天(8/16)同步上架。<br>专辑销售超过1300万张，四座葛莱美奖肯定的泰勒丝，原定在8月16日才要首播发行的新歌”我的最爱”，由于受到歌迷的高度期待，在8月3日就意外在网络上外流，低音质的MP3档案传遍全球各大部落格与YouTube。为了不让低音质的版本被歌迷误会以为就是专辑版本，一向对音乐作品自我要求极高的泰勒丝在与唱片公司紧急讨论过后，决定让新歌提前12天发行。这首新歌”我的最爱”在iTune发行当天只花了五个小时就打败了阿姆与蕾哈娜合唱的”Love the way you lie”登上当日销售冠军，刷新今年年初泰勒丝自己以单曲”宛如童话Today was a fairytale ”所写下的16个小时最快称霸当日销售冠军纪录。泰勒丝在今年年初以”宛如童话”空降单曲榜亚军，现在又以”我的最爱”空降本周告示牌单曲榜第3名，成为继玛丽亚凯莉之后，第二位在一年之内拥有两首空降单曲榜前五名的女歌手。<br>出道至今获奖无数的泰勒丝最近再添一座奖，不过好笑的是这次跟音乐可没有关系，而是在保龄球馆约会被偷拍，意外入选进入美国保龄球名人堂。今年泰勒丝被狗仔拍到与当红影集「Glee」中的帅学生柯瑞蒙特斯(Cory Monteith)想约打保龄球，并在保龄球馆抱抱的照片，这张照片在网络上到处流传，也让大家知道原来小天后也爱打保龄球。在美国保龄球协会举办的保龄球名人票选活动中，获得超过130万张投票，赢过小贾斯汀、赛琳娜戈梅兹等人，泰勒丝的名字将进入美国保龄球名人堂。不过泰勒丝与柯瑞都宣称「两人只是朋友」，这段绯闻并没有继续发展下去，只让泰勒丝获得因狗仔照片所拿的乌龙奖项，并继续感情空窗下去。<br>歌迷一直以来就是支持泰勒丝最大的力量，泰勒丝在日前就透过网络视讯，在官网、Face Book、Twitter等社群网络平台，领先媒体与歌迷分享新专辑最新讯息，新专辑【Speak Now】一共有14首 歌，全都由泰勒丝一手包办词曲创作，泰勒丝说：「在对的时间说出对的话是多么的重要，以致于我们常常会迟疑，因为我们会担心在不对的时候，说出不对的话， 但最近我更担心在什么话都还未说出口时，时间就这样溜走了。」令人好奇泰勒丝所指的是否就是这场无疾而终的保龄球恋情。, the way you lie\xe2\x80\x9d\xe7\x99\xbb\xe4\xb8\x8a\xe5\xbd\x93\xe6\x97\xa5\xe9\x94\x80\xe5\x94\xae\xe5\x86\xa0\xe5\x86\x9b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\x88\xb7\xe6\x96\xb0\xe4\xbb\x8a\xe5\xb9\xb4\xe5\xb9\xb4\xe5\x88\x9d\xe6\xb3\xb0\xe5\x8b\x92\xe4\xb8\x9d\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe5\x8d\x95\xe6\x9b\xb2\xe2\x80\x9d\xe5\xae\x9b\xe5\xa6\x82\xe7\xab\xa5\xe8\xaf\x9dToday was a fairytale \xe2\x80\x9d\xe6\x89\x80\xe5\x86\x99\xe4\xb8\x8b\xe7\x9a\x8416\xe4\xb8\xaa\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe6\x97\xb6\xe6\x9c\x80\xe5\xbf\xab\xe7\xa7\xb0\xe9\x9c\xb8\xe5\xbd\x93\xe6\x97\xa5\xe9\x94\x80\xe5\x94\xae\xe5\x86\xa0\xe5\x86\x9b\xe7\xba\xaa\xe5\xbd\x95\xe3\x80\x82\xe6\xb3\xb0\xe5\x8b\x92\xe4\xb8\x9d\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe4\xbb\x8a\xe5\xb9\xb4\xe5\xb9\xb4\xe5\x88\x9d\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe2\x80\x9d\xe5\xae\x9b\xe5\xa6\x82\xe7\xab\xa5\xe8\xaf\x9d\xe2\x80\x9d\xe7\xa9\xba\xe9\x99\x8d\xe5\x8d\x95\xe6\x9b\xb2\xe6\xa6\x9c\xe4\xba\x9a\xe5\x86\x9b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\x8e\xb0\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe5\x8f\x88\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe2\x80\x9d\xe6\x88\x91\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x9c\x80\xe7\x88\xb1\xe2\x80\x9d\xe7\xa9\xba\xe9\x99\x8d\xe6\x9c\xac\xe5\x91\xa8\xe5\x91\x8a\xe7\xa4\xba\xe7\x89\x8c\xe5\x8d\x95\xe6\x9b\xb2\xe6\xa6\x9c\xe7\xac\xac3\xe5\x90\x8d\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x88\x90\xe4\xb8\xba\xe7\xbb\xa7\xe7\x8e\x9b\xe4\xb8\xbd\xe4\xba\x9a\xe5\x87\xaf\xe8\x8e\x89\xe4\xb9\x8b\xe5\x90\x8e\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\xac\xac\xe4\xba\x8c\xe4\xbd\x8d\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\xb9\xb4\xe4\xb9\x8b\xe5\x86\x85\xe6\x8b\xa5\xe6\x9c\x89\xe4\xb8\xa4\xe9\xa6\x96\xe7\xa9\xba\xe9\x99\x8d\xe5\x8d\x95\xe6\x9b\xb2\xe6\xa6\x9c\xe5\x89\x8d\xe4\xba\x94\xe5\x90\x8d\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xa5\xb3\xe6\xad\x8c\xe6\x89\x8b\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe5\x87\xba\xe9\x81\x93\xe8\x87\xb3\xe4\xbb\x8a\xe8\x8e\xb7\xe5\xa5\x96\xe6\x97\xa0\xe6\x95\xb0\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\xb3\xb0\xe5\x8b\x92\xe4\xb8\x9d\xe6\x9c\x80\xe8\xbf\x91\xe5\x86\x8d\xe6\xb7\xbb\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\xba\xa7\xe5\xa5\x96\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe8\xbf\x87\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe7\xac\x91\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x98\xaf\xe8\xbf\x99\xe6\xac\xa1\xe8\xb7\x9f\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe4\xb9\x90\xe5\x8f\xaf\xe6\xb2\xa1\xe6\x9c\x89\xe5\x85\xb3\xe7\xb3\xbb\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\x80\x8c\xe6\x98\xaf\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe9\xa6\x86\xe7\xba\xa6\xe4\xbc\x9a\xe8\xa2\xab\xe5\x81\xb7\xe6\x8b\x8d\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x84\x8f\xe5\xa4\x96\xe5\x85\xa5\xe9\x80\x89\xe8\xbf\x9b\xe5\x85\xa5\xe7\xbe\x8e\xe5\x9b\xbd\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe5\x90\x8d\xe4\xba\xba\ Monteith)\xe6\x83\xb3\xe7\xba\xa6\xe6\x89\x93\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xb9\xb6\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe9\xa6\x86\xe6\x8a\xb1\xe6\x8a\xb1\xe7\x9a\x84\xe7\x85\xa7\xe7\x89\x87\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xbf\x99\xe5\xbc\xa0\xe7\x85\xa7\xe7\x89\x87\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe7\xbd\x91\xe7\xbb\x9c\xe4\xb8\x8a\xe5\x88\xb0\xe5\xa4\x84\xe6\xb5\x81\xe4\xbc\xa0\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe8\xae\xa9\xe5\xa4\xa7\xe5\xae\xb6\xe7\x9f\xa5\xe9\x81\x93\xe5\x8e\x9f\xe6\x9d\xa5\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe5\xa4\xa9\xe5\x90\x8e\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe7\x88\xb1\xe6\x89\x93\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe3\x80\x82\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe7\xbe\x8e\xe5\x9b\xbd\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe5\x8d\x8f\xe4\xbc\x9a\xe4\xb8\xbe\xe5\x8a\x9e\xe7\x9a\x84\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe5\x90\x8d\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\xa5\xa8\xe9\x80\x89\xe6\xb4\xbb\xe5\x8a\xa8\xe4\xb8\xad\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\x8e\xb7\xe5\xbe\x97\xe8\xb6\x85\xe8\xbf\x87130\xe4\xb8\x87\xe5\xbc\xa0\xe6\x8a\x95\xe7\xa5\xa8\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xb5\xa2\xe8\xbf\x87\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe8\xb4\xbe\xe6\x96\xaf\xe6\xb1\x80\xe3\x80\x81\xe8\xb5\x9b\xe7\x90\xb3\xe5\xa8\x9c\xe6\x88\x88\xe6\xa2\x85\xe5\x85\xb9\xe7\xad\x89\xe4\xba\xba\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\xb3\xb0\xe5\x8b\x92\xe4\xb8\x9d\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x90\x8d\xe5\xad\x97\xe5\xb0\x86\xe8\xbf\x9b\xe5\x85\xa5\xe7\xbe\x8e\xe5\x9b\xbd\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xbe\x84\xe7\x90\x83\xe5\x90\x8d\xe4\xba\xba\xe5\xa0\x82\xe3\x80\x82\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe8\xbf\x87\xe6\xb3\xb0\xe5\x8b\x92\xe4\xb8\x9d\xe4\xb8\x8e\xe6\x9f\xaf\xe7\x91\x9e\xe9\x83\xbd\xe5\xae\xa3\xe7\xa7\xb0\xe3\x80\x8c\xe4\xb8\xa4\xe4\xba\xba\xe5\x8f\xaa\xe6\x98\xaf\xe6\x9c\x8b\xe5\x8f\x8b\xe3\x80\x8d\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xbf\x99\xe6\xae\xb5\xe7\xbb\xaf\xe9\x97\xbb\xe5\xb9\xb6\xe6\xb2\xa1\xe6\x9c\x89\xe7\xbb\xa7\xe7\xbb\xad\xe5\x8f\x91\xe5\xb1\x95\xe4\xb8\x8b\xe5\x8e\xbb\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\x8f\xaa\xe8\xae\xa9\xe6\xb3\xb0\xe5\x8b\x92\xe4\xb8\x9d\xe8\x8e\xb7\xe5\xbe\x97\xe5\x9b\xa0\xe7\x8b\x97\xe4\xbb\x94\xe7\x85\xa7\xe7\x89\x87\xe6\x89\x80\xe6\x8b\xbf\xe7\x9a\x84\xe4\xb9\x8c\xe9\xbe 2012-05-02 23:01:37,173 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Doo-Wops & Hooligans, Peter Hernandez Jr.于1986年生于美国夏威夷，他的艺名Bruno Mars为人们熟知。Bruno Mars嗓音独特，凭借与B.o.B合作的出道单曲《Nothin’ On You》挤下了连续5个星期排名第一的蕾哈娜，在美国Billboard顺利拿下冠军。其他还有与Travis McCoy合作的Billionaire等。<br>Bruno Mars在美国夏威夷的威基基(Waikiki)岛上出生并长大，是父母的六个孩子中的一个，而父母分别是波多黎各和菲律宾人。他出生在一个音乐家庭，给了他多元化的Reggae，摇滚，嘻哈和R＆B等多种风格。在很小的时候，Bruno Mars就开始模仿和表演例如猫王、迈克尔杰克逊等很具影响力的艺术家的歌曲。1990年他四岁的时候被MidWeek杂志精选为“小猫王”，之后在1992年于拉斯维加斯的蜜月影片中扮演小猫王。 2003年，17岁的他于President Theodore Roosevelt高中毕业，之后搬到洛杉矶追求他自己的音乐生涯。在成为一个成功的歌手之前，Bruno Mars已是一位知名的音乐制作人，参与了Flo Rida去年红翻天的《Right Round》以及2010年世界杯主题曲《Wavin’ Flag》的写谱，还为 Maroon 5和Sean Kingston等歌手写歌或监制。在《Nothin’ On You》成功不久后，他就宣布在2010年5月11日推出自己的细碟《It’s Better If You Don’t Understand》，而个人首张专辑《Doo-Wops & Hooligans 》也在筹备当中，准备在今年10月5日发行。同时来自新专辑的首支单曲《Just The Way You Are》已经在2010年7月19日发行，此曲MV也在今年9月8日发行，在美国Billboard Hot 100单曲榜上榜9周后终于不负重望夺得了冠军。新专辑的二单《Liquor Store Blues》也在9月21日在iTunes Store开放下载。, 2012-05-02 23:01:39,720 INFO 1335970899.71.jpg封面下载成功
2012-05-02 23:01:39,720 INFO 开始添加
2012-05-02 23:01:39,726 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (再见王子, 來自街頭的聲音。飄浮在城市天空的「棉花糖」。<br>柔軟卻剛強，義無反顧地行進。<br>棉花糖[katncandix2] 小球+聖哲<br>第2張全創作專輯 [再見王子]<br>再見夢想。再見初戀。再見淚水。再見昨天。<br>必須向天真的自己說再見，才能勇敢地冒險找到未來。<br>幻滅之後的蛻變，是重生的那一刻。<br>「小飛行」好評後 嚴選《再見王子》《好日子》《怎麼說呢?》《回不去的旅人》<br>全新格局 10篇刻印成長的青春創作<br>詞+曲+創作+製作+演唱 棉花糖<br>棉花糖的音樂形成自成一格的清透感，<br>純淨透徹、青春明亮，為城市趕走煩躁滯悶的壞空氣，帶來新鮮的氣息。<br>2009「小飛行」好評後 青春第二章 全新格局成長力作 2010「再見王子」<br>2009年，棉花糖帶著清新明亮的音樂現身樂壇，以街頭藝人身份發行第一張全創作專輯「小飛行」。他們的出現引起樂評與媒體關注，屢次獲得佳績並贏得許多音樂獎項。棉花糖在2009年勇奪大陸湖南衛視"節節高聲"季度冠軍、新加坡Fresh music Awards音樂評選大獎年度最佳新音樂團體、同時入選博客來年度百大專輯；2010年再接再厲獲選大陸光線音樂榜"最佳新人組合獎"、9+2音樂先鋒榜"年度最佳樂隊組合獎"、以及新加坡FESTIVA音樂節台灣樂團演出代表。媒體青睞與各類獎項肯定，逐一證明了棉花糖在流行樂壇存在的必要性與未來性。<br>棉花糖自然散發出質樸與新鮮，完全體現在創作裡。不取巧不張揚的態度，在熱鬧有餘、譁眾取寵的市場中，自有一股天然清新氣味流露。青澀純真的藝人特質，和煦溫暖的音樂，就棉花糖能在這麼多專業獎項與主流市場勝出的原因。<br>2009年是棉花糖初試啼聲的關鍵時刻。2010年是他們持續發光發熱的一年。<br>經過一年多海內外表演活動的磨練，棉花糖奔走遊唱在多個陌生與熟悉的城市裡，聖哲拎著一把吉他搭著小球的歌聲，到處傳遞棉花糖的歌聲與溫暖。就像是坐上一艘搭載著夢想與熱血的小飛機一般，棉花糖唱到哪兒就駐足在哪兒，充滿無敵的青春與洋溢的活力。一回回飛行累積的夢想日誌，讓棉花糖的眼界開了，視野開了，心靈也跟著打開了。飛出棉花糖小小世界之外，每一次經歷都在開拓生活界限；每一次碰觸都在累積創作能量。<br>[小飛行]前，棉花糖說：「沒有試著為夢想飛行，怎麼知道自己瘋狂活過！」<br>[小飛行]後，棉花糖堅信：「以扎實步伐往夢想走，每個腳步的烙印都在見證成長！」<br>棉花糖飛行日誌記載旅途中迸發的歡笑淚水、牽掛拉扯、真實與體悟。歷經一趟不凡有趣的生活旅程後，棉花糖帶著豐收滿滿的心情與靈感筆記，著手進行第二張全創作專輯[再見王子]錄音製作。這一段飛行過程，可說是棉花糖的圓夢/尋找之旅。從街頭藝人到發片歌手，從夢想到生活，從純真童話到成人現實，進入製作閉關期的棉花糖，不斷地進行反覆的自我省視與心靈對話，最常討論就是「變」與「不變」，「選擇」與「冒險」與「賭注」，「告別」與「學習」…人生重要課題。<br>「夢想」是首張專輯「小飛行」創作概念，而「成長」則是第二張專輯[再見王子]首要探討想法，整張專輯由最初的觀望遲疑『這就是我要的嗎?』『為什麼進了最大的努力，結果卻跟我想像不一樣?』『人生是個選擇題，該不該做這個決定?』，轉而到傳遞正面明亮的向上能量『我知道必須向天真的自己說再見，但我能更勇敢冒險找到未來幸福快樂的好日子。』，專輯想法清晰明瞭，完整鋪陳，不僅表達棉花糖對現實環境的想法，也直接反映了青春世代對成人世界的態度。<br>『啊!!!如果能重來那就好了。』我們時常這樣想著…<br>可是妳 /你知道的，重頭開始很容易，可是一提到告別卻困難極了。<br>我們在生活中，不斷告別、不斷重頭，只是 我還在學習。<br>告別逝去的親情、友情、愛情與自己，告別了心中的小王子。<br>當我蛻變的時候，就是重生的時候。 BY棉花糖[katncandix2], upload/1335970899.71.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 棉花糖, 2010, 49, 2012-05-02 23:01:47,706 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Myself 概念专辑, 蔡依林2010全新国语专辑即将发行<br>出道至今 蔡依林首次以自己的名字作为专辑名称<br>命名全新专辑为『蔡依林同名专辑VOGUE』<br>JOLIN秘练全新舞蹈-VOGUING向玛丹娜致敬<br>玛丹娜老师Benny Ninja大赞JOLIN天赋高<br>JOLIN也是全程完整跳完VOGUING的艺人<br>相隔一年又3个月，蔡依林终於将要推出全新『蔡依林同名专辑VOGUE』，为了这张她高度参予的专辑，Jolin正在韩国积极练舞以及拍摄专辑预购、封面照，她说：「这是我出道以来参予最多的专辑，呈现了最真实的自我！因此我相当期待！可以说是出道至今最令我兴奋的一张专辑！」<br>蔡依林推出的每张专辑都叫好叫座，专辑名称更是一张比一张令人印象深刻，从『舞娘』、『特务J』到『花蝴蝶』…经过了唱片公和经纪公司的包装，Jolin都是以歌手身分在扮演别的角色，不同於以往，所以经过公司和蔡依林的讨论之后，决定将专辑名称就叫做『蔡依林同名专辑VOUGE』！希望真实展现属於蔡依林目前的生活态度！出道至今，蔡依林的每张专辑都不曾以她的名字命名，这次她要真正的扮演蔡依林自己！蔡依林更进一步说：「在同名专辑之后加上『VOGUE』则是我的提议，是因为对我而言VOGUE代表的是一种态度、一种精神、一种自信心，而并不只是来自於美丽的外貌或是过度包装的华服。我心目中的VOGUE代表的就是生活态度，真实的自我，我知道who I am！」『蔡依林同名专辑VOGUE』就是一张完整贯串自我的概念性专辑！<br>蔡依林勇於突破自我、甩开包袱，希望忠实呈现自己…从很多小地方可以看出。比如说：蔡依林坚持亲自经营她的微博网站、PO上她跳完舞后满头大汗的素颜照、说出她最想说的话….展现了全然的自信，并且完全不在乎旁人的眼光，她说：「做自己想做的事，这就是最时尚的生活方式！」Jolin也不讳言这张专辑是她有史以来参予最多，唱片公司和经纪公司也全数采纳她的意见，收歌过程中，Jolin听到每首歌都一定会先问：『这歌是原创的吗？』JOLIN本人坚持这张专辑是毫无翻唱曲，因此在新专辑中收录的国内外创作者都是原创歌曲，就连这次新专辑最主要的舞蹈风格都还是蔡依林自己的idea，主动表示自己想学已经在国外风糜许久的舞蹈『VOGUING』！<br>『VOGUING』是一种以手部姿势为主的舞蹈，开始在70年代和80年代。彷佛把模特儿摆的POSE串连成流利的舞蹈动作，讲究灵活性的完美线条构成！在国外相当流行。Jolin的灵感来自於超级天后玛丹娜，也希望透过学习『VOGUING』向这位世界级的巨星致敬。不过，据舞蹈老师Benny Ninja表示：「当年就连玛丹娜的MV中，玛丹娜本人都不曾亲自跳完全程，大部分是由身边的舞者诠释！因此JOLIN将会是首位全程跳完VOGUING的艺人！」这一次华纳音乐特别找来世界首席VOGUING舞蹈老师Benny Ninja(班尼忍者)，同时也是当年指导玛丹娜『VOGUE』的老师，连老师都说Jolin学的非常快，也是他教过的艺人学生里面跳最好也是跳最多的艺人！Jolin也说：「刚学的时候真的蛮难的，手指都快要打结了！」她也迫不及待呈现这张『蔡依林同名专辑VOUGE』给大家看了！, upload/1335970907.69.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 蔡依林, 2010, 2012-05-02 23:01:50,344 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (倫敦的愛情, 藍又時 用＜聲音＞和＜弦律＞，讓你聽最美的畫面，陪你找… 最深刻的那個人。<br>聽完了她的<秘密>，讓她陪你找尋....   最深刻的那個人，藍又時  二號創作專輯＜倫敦的愛情＞<br>哪一段愛情，讓你努力忘也忘不掉？<br>就像現在的溫度一樣，那麼深刻清晰。<br>哪一段愛情，會讓你奮不顧身的去愛，卻也毅然決然的放手？<br>2006年的一首『曾經太年輕』，使得藍又時備受矚目，獨特的嗓音讓人聽得記憶深刻，年紀輕輕的她，一度成為唱片市場詢問度最高的發片新人。藍又時長期隱藏於幕後作為音樂創作人，十七歲發表了第一首創作歌曲，就是收錄在劉若英專輯裡的<什麼時候>。在眾目睽睽之下，於2009年發行了個人首張一號創作專輯《祕密 The Secret》，透過許多的音樂製作人.電台DJ.幕後音樂人的肯定推薦，也更加奠定了藍又時的創作功力。期中也陸續不間斷的為許多天王天后創作，她只說：『音樂是說話的旋律，也是種紀錄。』<br>一個多變的藍又時，誠懇的去變化自己。不為改變而改變，而是在好多個藍又時裡，相互交換著。想笑的時候，就是不掩藏的笑出聲; 想哭得時候，也不考慮淚會流向哪裡; 想寫就寫，想哼就唱; 想畫就畫，想動就跳。她說，這不是一種『自我』，只是一個『自己』。二號創作專輯<倫敦的愛情>裡面，發現了好多藍又時的『自己』，你會驚訝，她是怎麼把這麼多個自己帶出來的。藍又時，依然只是唱著、寫著這個世代的<小>事情，屬於我們的小事情。<br>你還反覆聽著那張聽不膩的『祕密』cd片嗎？<br>準備好，讓她再一次打開你的心。<br>藍又時， 二號創作專輯 <倫敦 的  愛情>，5月7號感動出輯。<br>『這些弦律是種紀錄  一張不選擇跟隨別人的專輯<br>10首沒有時效性的歌  一輩子要陪著你 。』<br>你曾想過會有一張專輯能夠直接打開你的心嗎？在碟裡，她的聲音穿透過麥克風的口吻，你會知道什麼是真實的紀錄。每一個喘息，每一個音調，每一句說話的弦律，每一個情緒，『藍又時。當她一開口，你就會知道她是誰。』<br>總是以為不容易被人看穿，也以為看穿不了別人，將自己頑梗的鎖在幻想的世界裡面，躲在自己的圈圈裡，一種永無止境的自我限制，就好像<圓規>的中心點一樣，獨自一個人，只能用雙手擁抱著自己取暖，這就是我們所謂的『自我保護』？<br>在<誰比誰>了之後，那樣無趣的競爭就會永遠停止？不會，因為她就是這樣過來的。嘗試著用各種方式去大喊，用盡力氣去表達，只是不願再看見一個和她一樣受傷害的人，總對人提醒著，希望終究能<聽我的勸>告，能停止再踏出錯誤的步伐。但人總是習慣在跌倒受傷了之後，才會一輩子去小心<br>翼翼的行走每一步路。<br>讓我們去真心的<聽聽>自己心裡面那極為細小的聲音好不好？去感受自己胸口裡的天氣，過去或者天天都在下著雨，但這溫柔的陽光，終究還是灑進來了，那段在<倫敦的愛情>，是那樣的美輪美奐，是那樣的捨不得，是那樣的令人流連忘返。然而，每件事總是那麼樣的<一體兩面>，總會忘記了最初的願望，過去總是渴望對方過得比自己好，總是渴望自己能夠多給對方一些什麼，但是，到最後？我們卻在望著自己的雙手，看自己究竟得到了什麼？就算得不到，那又怎樣呢？<br><序>，總是開不了章節，因為我們的愛，總是那麼有限，也總以為自己可以愛一輩子。有的時候，先改變的卻是自己，到頭來，堅強卻成了一種自我保護，就像那<魚的淚>，都是看不見的淚水，但也或許，它根本不會哭，這答案沒有人知道，連魚兒自己也不會明白。『而<你>，有人懂你的眼淚嗎？你找到那個<最懂我>的人了嗎？<br>偶像劇的新聲帶，這次，將顛覆你想像的局限。<br>『曾經太年輕』，『孤單心事』，『那天』，『你』，都是藍又時的祕密。<br>惡作劇二吻的片尾曲『你』，源自於藍又時之手，在部落格上播放的demo版本，受到網路歌迷們的喜愛，卻遲遲無法正式聽見原唱版本。亞洲獅音樂特別於藍又時2號創作專輯中收錄這首膾炙人口的好歌，有別於林依晨的可愛甜蜜版，更讓你體驗愛情的感動。<br>新世代<自癒系>創作女生的崛起，卻也療癒了別人。<br>你有多久沒有在意你的心了？聽見她的聲音，你會知道，藍又時懂你的眼淚，懂你的傷痕。面對，永遠是最難的，忘記，也是最不容易的。但漠視自己的心，是最常做到的。<br>到底什麼叫做，都『過去了』？雖然那是刻在你心版上的傷，但它，卻已經過去了。你願意乖乖的，擦藥讓它痊愈嗎？別再去撕裂它，也別再掩蓋它了，讓我們好好看看自己身上的傷口，清楚的看著它，你自然就會知道，它該怎麼好起來了。但，你需要那樣的勇敢去看。我們不要再轉身回頭看了，給自己一個走下去的理由。<br>『聽她唱，然後，打開心，讓藍又時進入你的生命。』, upload/1335970910.33.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 藍又時, 2010, 4, 4712523870706, 亞神音樂, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['\xe5\x80\xab\xe6\x95\xa6\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x84\x9b\xe6\x83\x85', \xe6\x9b\xb2\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe6\x98\xaf\xe6\x94\xb6\xe9\x8c\x84\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe5\x8a\x89\xe8\x8b\xa5\xe8\x8b\xb1\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf\xe8\xa3\xa1\xe7\x9a\x84<\xe4\xbb\x80\xe9\xba\xbc\xe6\x99\x82\xe5\x80\x99>\xe3\x80\x82\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe7\x9c\xbe\xe7\x9b\xae\xe7\x9d\xbd\xe7\x9d\xbd\xe4\xb9\x8b\xe4\xb8\x8b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x96\xbc2009\xe5\xb9\xb4\xe7\x99\xbc\xe8\xa1\x8c\xe4\xba\x86\xe5\x80\x8b\xe4\xba\xba\xe9\xa6\x96\xe5\xbc\xb5\xe4\xb8\x80\xe8\x99\x9f\xe5\x89\xb5\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf\xe3\x80\x8a\xe7\xa5\x95\xe5\xaf\x86 The Secret\xe3\x80\x8b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe9\x80\x8f\xe9\x81\x8e\xe8\xa8\xb1\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe7\x9a\x84\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe6\xa8\x82\xe8\xa3\xbd\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe4\xba\xba.\xe9\x9b\xbb\xe5\x8f\xb0DJ.\xe5\xb9\x95\xe5\xbe\x8c\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe6\xa8\x82\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x82\xaf\xe5\xae\x9a\xe6\x8e\xa8\xe8\x96\xa6\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe6\x9b\xb4\xe5\x8a\xa0\xe5\xa5\xa0\xe5\xae\x9a\xe4\xba\x86\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x89\xb5\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe5\x8a\x9f\xe5\x8a\x9b\xe3\x80\x82\xe6\x9c\x9f\xe4\xb8\xad\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe9\x99\xb8\xe7\xba\x8c\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe9\x96\x93\xe6\x96\xb7\xe7\x9a\x84\xe7\x82\xba\xe8\xa8\xb1\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe5\xa4\xa9\xe7\x8e\x8b\xe5\xa4\xa9\xe5\x90\x8e\xe5\x89\xb5\xe4\xbd\x9c\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe5\x8f\xaa\xe8\xaa\xaa\xef\xbc\x9a\xe3\x80\x8e\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe6\xa8\x82\xe6\x98\xaf\xe8\xaa\xaa\xe8\xa9\xb1\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x97\x8b\xe5\xbe\x8b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe6\x98\xaf\xe7\xa8\xae\xe7\xb4\x80\xe9\x8c\x84\xe3\x80\x82\xe3\x80\x8f<br>\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe8\xae\x8a\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xaa\xa0\xe6\x87\x87\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x8e\xbb\xe8\xae\x8a\xe5\x8c\x96\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe3\x80\x82\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe7\x82\xba\xe6\x94\xb9\xe8\xae\x8a\xe8\x80\x8c\xe6\x94\xb9\xe8\xae\x8a\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\x80\x8c\xe6\x98\xaf\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe5\x80\x8b\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xe8\xa3\xa1\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\x9b\xb8\xe4\xba\x92\xe4\xba\xa4\xe6\x8f\x9b\xe8\x91\x97\xe3\x80\x82\xe6\x83\xb3\xe7\xac\x91\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x99\x82\xe5\x80\x99\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe6\x98\xaf\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe6\x8e\xa9\xe8\x97\x8f\xe7\x9a\x84\xe7\xac\x91\xe5\x87\xba\xe8\x81\xb2; \xe6\x83\xb3\xe5\x93\xad\xe5\xbe\x97\xe6\x99\x82\xe5\x80\x99\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe8\x80\x83\xe6\x85\xae\xe6\xb7\x9a\xe6\x9c\x83\xe6\xb5\x81\xe5\x90\x91\xe5\x93\xaa\xe8\xa3\xa1; \xe6\x83\xb3\xe5\xaf\xab\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe5\xaf\xab\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x83\xb3\xe5\x93\xbc\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe5\x94\xb1; \xe6\x83\xb3\xe7\x95\xab\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe7\x95\xab\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x83\xb3\xe5\x8b\x95\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe8\xb7\xb3\xe3\x80\x82\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe8\xaa\xaa\xef\xbc\x8c\xe9\x80\x99\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe6\x98\xaf\xe4\xb8\x80\xe7\xa8\xae\xe3\x80\x8e\xe8\x87\xaa\xe6\x88\x91\xe3\x80\x8f\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\x8f\xaa\xe6\x98\xaf\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe3\x80\x8e\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe3\x80\x8f\xe3\x80\x82\xe4\xba\x8c\xe8\x99\x9f\xe5\x89\xb5\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf<\xe5\x80\xab\xe6\x95\xa6\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x84\x9b\xe6\x83\x85>\xe8\xa3\xa1\xe9\x9d\xa2\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\x99\xbc\xe7\x8f\xbe\xe4\xba\x86\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xe7\x9a\x84\xe3\x80\x8e\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe3\x80\x8f\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe6\x9c\x83\xe9\xa9\x9a\xe8\xa8\x9d\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe6\x98\xaf\xe6\x80\x8e\xe9\xba\xbc\xe6\x8a\x8a\xe9\x80\x99\xe9\xba\xbc\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe5\x80\x8b\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe5\xb8\xb6\xe5\x87\xba\xe4\xbe\x86\xe7\x9a\x84\xe3\x80\x82\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xbe\x9d\xe7\x84\xb6\xe5\x8f\xaa\xe6\x98\xaf\xe5\x94\xb1\xe8\x91\x97\xe3\x80\x81\xe5\xaf\xab\xe8\x91\x97\xe9\x80\x99\xe5\x80\x8b\xe4\xb8\x96\xe4\xbb\xa3\xe7\x9a\x84<\xe5\xb0\x8f>\xe4\xba\x8b\xe6\x83\x85\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xb1\xac\xe6\x96\xbc\xe6\x88\x91\xe5\x80\x91\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe4\xba\x8b\xe6\x83\x85\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe9\x82\x84\xe5\x8f\x8d\xe8\xa6\x86\xe8\x81\xbd\xe8\x91\x97\xe9\x82\xa3\xe5\xbc\xb5\xe8\x81\xbd\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe8\x86\xa9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe3\x80\x8e\xe7\xa5\x95\xe5\xaf\x86\xe3\x80\x8fcd\xe7\x89\x87\xe5\x97\x8e\xef\xbc\x9f<br>\xe6\xba\x96\xe5\x82\x99\xe5\xa5\xbd\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xae\x93\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe5\x86\x8d\xe4\xb8\x80\xe6\xac\xa1\xe6\x89\x93\xe9\x96\x8b\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xbf\x83\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xef\xbc\x8c \xe4\xba\x8c\xe8\x99\x9f\xe5\x89\xb5\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf <\xe5\x80\xab\xe6\x95\xa6 \xe7\x9a\x84  \xe6\x84\x9b\xe6\x83\x85>\xef\xbc\x8c5\xe6\x9c\x887\xe8\x99\x9f\xe6\x84\x9f\xe5\x8b\x95\xe5\x87\xba\xe8\xbc\xaf\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe3\x80\x8e\xe9\x80\x99\xe4\xba\x9b\xe5\xbc\xa6\xe5\xbe\x8b\xe6\x98\xaf\xe7\xa8\xae\xe7\xb4\x80\xe9\x8c\x84  \xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\xbc\xb5\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe9\x81\xb8\xe6\x93\x87\xe8\xb7\x9f\xe9\x9a\xa8\xe5\x88\xa5\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf<br>10\xe9\xa6\x96\xe6\xb2\x92\xe6\x9c\x89\xe6\x99\x82\xe6\x95\x88\xe6\x80\xa7\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\xad\x8c \xe3\x80\x82\xe3\x80\x8f<br>\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe6\x9b\xbe\xe6\x83\xb3\xe9\x81\x8e\xe6\x9c\x83\xe6\x9c\x89\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\xbc\xb5\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf\xe8\x83\xbd\xe5\xa4\xa0\xe7\x9b\xb4\xe6\x8e\xa5\xe6\x89\x93\xe9\x96\x8b\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xbf\x83\xe5\x97\x8e\xef\xbc\x9f\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe7\xa2\x9f\xe8\xa3\xa1\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x81\xb2\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe7\xa9\xbf\xe9\x80\x8f\xe9\x81\x8e\xe9\xba\xa5\xe5\x85\x8b\xe9\xa2\xa8\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x8f\xa3\xe5\x90\xbb\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe6\x9c\x83\xe7\x9f\xa5\xe9\x81\x93\xe4\xbb\x80\xe9\xba\xbc\xe6\x98\xaf\xe7\x9c\x9f\xe5\xaf\xa6\xe7\x9a\x84\xe7\xb4\x80\xe9\x8c\x84\xe3\x80\x82\xe6\xaf\x8f\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe5\x96\x98\xe6\x81\xaf\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\xaf\x8f\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe8\xaa\xbf\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\xaf\x8f\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x8f\xa5\xe8\xaa\xaa\xe8\xa9\xb1\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xbc\xa6\xe5\xbe\x8b\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\xaf\x8f\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe6\x83\x85\xe7\xb7\x92\xef\xbc\x8c\xe3\x80\x8e\xe8\x97\x8d\xe5\x8f\x88\xe6\x99\x82\xe3\x80\x82\xe7\x95\xb6\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe4\xb8\x80\xe9\x96\x8b\xe5\x8f\xa3\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe6\x9c\x83\xe7\x9f\xa5\xe9\x81\x93\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe6\x98\xaf\xe8\xaa\xb0\xe3\x80\x82\xe3\x80\x8f<br>\xe7\xb8\xbd\xe6\x98\xaf\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe7\x82\xba\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe5\xae\xb9\xe6\x98\x93\xe8\xa2\xab\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x9c\x8b\xe7\xa9\xbf\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe7\x82\xba\xe7\x9c\x8b\xe7\xa9\xbf\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe4\xba\x86\xe5\x88\xa5\xe4\xba\xba\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xb0\x87\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe9\xa0\x91\xe6\xa2\x97\xe7\x9a\x84\xe9\x8e\x96\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe5\xb9\xbb\xe6\x83\xb3\xe7\x9a\x84\xe4\xb8\x96\xe7\x95\x8c\xe8\xa3\xa1\xe9\x9d\xa2\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xba\xb2\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x9c\x88\xe5\x9c\x88\xe8\xa3\xa1\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xb8\x80\xe7\xa8\xae\xe6\xb0\xb8\xe7\x84\xa1\xe6\xad\xa2\xe5\xa2\x83\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x87\xaa\xe6\x88\x91\xe9\x99\x90\xe5\x88\xb6\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xb0\xb1\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe5\x83\x8f<\xe5\x9c\x93\xe8\xa6\x8 2012-05-02 23:04:12,424 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Easy, 这是一张有趣的不插电专辑，首次担当出品人以及制作人，得以亲历一张唱片从无到有所要付出的繁杂工作，也是乐在其中的体验。发表《少年故事》之后的两年间，生活在发生改变，也都在重新开始。想用音乐记录下来的心情使人渴望尝试某种新的创作，由此产生的压力投射在现实中也带来了不小的阻碍 。但当我寻求于一直以来感动我的声音，才发现那往往只是一种粗糙和原始的方式，包裹着最纯粹而直接的表达。在今年十月，这一切促使着我萌发了制作这张《EASY》的想法，如果我坚持，是否可以不要层层叠叠的立项和审核，不要适时的市场分析和预算评估，不用禁闭在以小时计费的recording studio里，不用逐字逐句的修饰和精致润色，只是还原出一首歌在心中最初的样子。专辑中收录了四首新歌和五首来自《少年故事》的曲目，以两把箱琴为主的极简方式录制完成。全部的制作周期不到一个月，其间正逢北京入冬的两场瑞雪，享受着录音的状态轻松而愉快。感谢我的爱人，还有制作人吴涛以及太合麦田唱片的许多朋友的帮助。在真正投入到下一张录音室专辑的制作以前，我需要积蓄更多的能量，对于一直支持我的乐迷，希望你们会喜欢这一份2009年岁末的礼物。<br>——彭坦 "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (HELLO 梁心颐, Hello, 生活在城市里的人们, 你好吗?<br>甜嗓女孩 梁心颐Lara 首张专辑<br>追寻音乐的纯粹本质 11首有机音乐+简单文学 带你进入无扰空间 Everybody Say「Hello」<br>「 我不需要一个很大的舞台, 我只需要一对肯听的耳朵｡ 」<br>历时两年才完成这一张 专辑, 聊起自己现在对做音乐的感受, Lara有这样的体悟｡<br>个性直爽的她, 对「Lara梁心颐」这个艺人的定义是：诚实honest, 简单simple, 微甜sweet ｡<br>她说做音乐很简单, 因为诚实很简单, 找到属于自己的舒服方式玩音乐, 与这个世界分享所收集的故事和想法, 然后用Lara独特、清亮的微甜嗓音诠释出来｡<br>单飞后的Lara不急著快快发片, 不担心在萤光幕前消失太久, 反倒是耗费了两年的时间做这张专辑, 她花时间在找自我, 和音乐的本质, 舍弃繁华的电脑音色和包装, 如何简化一切, 回归最天然的最纯粹的｡ 这是她坚持的风格, 不管是音乐或生活｡<br>Lara的首张个人专辑, 以【HELLO】简单的招呼语作为专辑名称, 这是专辑第一波主打歌「Everything」的第一句歌词, 真诚的向好久不见的你问候Say Hello, 也对自己Say Hello, 和世界重新自我介绍崭新出辑的Lara梁心颐｡ 这张专辑共收录11首Lara对各种情感面向的抒发观感, Lara在新专辑中大展文学才华, 亲手包办9首歌词创作以及2首作曲, 也收录好友张杰、杨瑞代、音乐新人叶怀佩(Andrew)和伍家辉的作品, 更有Lara和姊姊共同创作的女孩心声, 还有Lara和爸爸父女联手玩翻摇滚的歌曲｡<br>而这次出辑Lara更如愿以偿亲自担任制作人, 从头到尾参与新专辑的制作讨论, 专辑音乐以『有机音乐organic music』为主轴概念, “有机”指的是乐器声音的天然性以及扎实, 偏重Live的感觉, 减少运用科技的电脑音色, 要给予你正向的震动能量, 是拥有正面思考的一种精神, 追求的是一种原始的完美, 不过度修饰或添加太多人工化学音乐成分｡ Lara说在”有机音乐”中, 每一个现场弹奏的声音都拥有演奏者的情感和个性, 所有音色交叠在一起的时候产生的厚度是科技无法取代的! 这种天然的音乐就是拥有一种神奇的魔力, 能穿透到人的心坎里, 医疗我们因为社会的复杂所遭受的伤害及碎裂的情感｡<br>当然, 她知道自己没那么伟大, 她一个只是勤练吉他、爱音乐的22岁女孩, 没有家人和身边所有工作伙伴的帮忙, 她不可能完成这张专辑｡ 只是希望能透过这样的音乐概念, 鼓励大家回到简单、真实的生活方式所给的轻松与自在, 2012-05-02 23:04:48,022 DEBUG (0.043) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (優雅的刺蝟, 其實你不曾等待過，因為他從來沒有離開<br>她的微笑依舊，但長大了；她的纖細如常，但成熟了；在幾百個日子過後，她收集生活的創作能量，在音樂裡、聲音裡讓你聽見她的…完整。<br>在「優雅的刺蝟」音樂專輯中，魏如萱運用音樂和聲音的關係創造視覺化的想像，猶如一座刺蝟般的迷宮，遇見的是留下行走空間的通道而非一面一面圍堵的巨牆，她在聲音裡為你預留探尋的線索，你無須握住地圖就可以輕易的找到出口。<br>十首歌是十個刺蝟迷宮裡的路徑，每首歌都是通道也是出口，聽著「困在」你可以找到感傷悠慢的頁面、哼唱「外星人愛我」你可以尋獲純真快樂的天堂、看著「問號」你會重新比對著自己內在和外在的平衡，而「局部的人」、「一刀兩刃」則更大膽的向你示意─拋開流行音樂的框架，往遼闊的音樂國界飛去…..<br>由創作音樂人陳珊妮創作的「我不是數學家」，裡面寫著三角愛情的絮絮喃語，和男友共同譜寫的「一顆灰塵」炙熱又直接的敘述愛情或愛情外兩人之間的長久依附的關係，但這首歌非關二人的感情。<br>某種意識上，魏如萱告別往常的天真甜美歌聲，表現著青春和成熟的擺渡，又某種說法上，魏如萱遠離音樂創作的限度，飛往沒有派別系統的音樂天空去，但是她的柔軟仍在、貼近仍存，刺蝟在外在的刺感之下明透而溫柔的內在是從未消失，別忘優雅以待……, Fans and Idol viewers know Crystal is a talented singer, but Farmer s Daughter further establishes her as a truly gifted songwriter. Farmer's Daughter was produced by David Bendeth (Paramore, Breaking Benjamin, Papa Roach).<br>After finishing up the 2010 American Idol Live Tour, Bowersox headed to New Jersey to begin production on her eagerly awaited debut. The twelve tracks, ten of them written or co-written by Bowersox, showcase her strong songwriting skills and her desire to infuse her lyrics with that raw emotion of someone who has lived. The album also contains eight songs written solely by Crystal, two co-writes, an additional track by Kara DioGuardi and Nickelback s Chad Kroeger titled Hold On and a cover of Buffalo Springfield s 1967 classic For What It s Worth. 2012-05-02 23:10:32,530 DEBUG (0.003) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Further, 創下五張錄音室舞曲專輯連續完封全英專輯金榜的全英電音首席天團「化學兄弟The Chemical Brothers」，預訂於2010.06.07全英發行、暌違三年之久的第七張錄音室專輯《Further》！<br>特別的是，新輯所收錄的八首作品，更邀來知名影像視覺大師Adam Smith和Marcus Lyall搭檔，執掌打造八首專屬的音樂視覺影像！其中，化名Flat Nose George的Adam Smith，更是從1994年開始，就參與製作化學兄弟每次現場演出的舞台視覺影像。全英舞曲音樂界的首席至尊，與當今視覺影像界的當紅鬼才，兩組默契十足的創作搭檔，從新輯錄音初期就開始密切合作，所完成的最新大碟《Further》，將讓樂迷不僅聽得更遠、還要看得更遠。<br>It starts with what sounds like an alien morse code transmission; Earth bound signals bouncing off the side of orbiting space debris. Snatches of voices found out in the ether cut through the machine fog, drifting across burbling analogue equipment lovingly kept working long after supposed sell-by date. By the time the click and thump of snare and bass drum arrive, the sounds are all-encompassing, swirling around you with dizzying, disorientating effect. Noises come untethered by constraints of volume, seemingly leaping from the speakers with a life of their own. For a band used to dealing in psychedelics, this time round The Chemical Brothers have really pushed the proverbial envelope.<br>The Chemical Brothers release their seventh studio album, “Further”, in June 2010. This album is the band’s first to be released with corresponding films made specifically to match each of the 8 audio tracks.<br>Nearly three years on from the release of their fifth consecutive UK Number 1 “We Are The Night”, “Further” sees Tom Rowlands and Ed Simons explore the boundless possibilities of their sound. Taking a trip through four decades of electronic noise, Tom & Ed have taken the template set up with their occasional “Electronic Battle Weapon” releases and allowed them to mutate gloriously into an entire album. Voice samples and snatches of vocals are woven through tracks to create a record that ebbs and flows like one of the band’s legendary live sets. Here, West Coast power pop harmonies sit beside German Motorik rhythms while Valentines-esque sonic manipulations plane across the top of early house basslines. “Further” is the culmination of nearly two decades of psychedelic exploration, an immersive collection that finds The Chemical Brothers at their least-restrained and most-melodic best.<br>As well as an eight-track album, “Further” is the band’s first proper partnership with long-time visuals collaborators Adam Smith and Marcus Lyall. Now as respected TV and film director (recently having completed the first episode of the forthcoming series of Doctor Who) Adam – aka Flat Nose George - has been responsible for creating the visual backdrop for every Chemical Brothers gig since their live debut in 1994. Visuals for “Further” have been created to correspond with each track on the album and have been planned during the recording of the record.<br>The band’s four shows running from the 20 – 23rd May at the Roundhouse (which sold out in record time) and gigs at Sonar Festival and selected festivals in Europe will see the band play the album and Smith and Lyall’s new films in their entirety. These will only be seen in sequence at those gigs. The Roundhouse shows will be the first chance to hear the album anywhere. After the gigs, the films will feature on a special edition DVD release and on iTunes LP., upload/1335971432.52.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, The Chemical Brothers, 2010, 81, 4988006879997, 自己可能也没想到，她会成为让旷课乐一发不可收拾地流行起来的女先锋。旷课乐是一种原本流行于美国南方的舞曲，用重低音击打出不断勾引脚底的节奏，并且以鲜艳的旋律色彩让人一听就上瘾，最近因火热表现而被称誉为‘流行乐之王’的亚瑟小子 (Usher) 的12周超级冠军单曲 "Yeah" 即是旷课乐的第一支代表作，席亚拉 (Ciara) 则是第二位以这种风格作品走红的艺人 (以女生来讲是第一人) 。<br>席亚拉 (Ciara) 挟带着她的多才多艺与诱人的歌声、无法抵挡的创作魅力以及技惊四座的舞步，不但强化了这种乐风涨满活力的炽热能量，同时也为原本阳刚味十足的旷课乐，注入了不同于以往的女性观点。, upload/1335971563.93.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, Ciara, 2010, 324, 0886977209222, La Face, 2012-05-02 23:13:07,809 DEBUG (0.015) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Jason Castro, With his rich tenor voice, distinctive looks, and endearingly innocent charm, Jason Castro won over millions of viewers as a contestant on the seventh season of American Idol, parlaying his substantial singer-songwriter appeal into a third-place runner-up finish. He may not have won the competition, but the 22-year-old Texan earned himself a devoted fan base eager to hear what he would do once freed to perform his own songs. Those folks will get their chance with the release of Castro's self-titled debut album on Atlantic Records.<br>Though rooted in the classic, melody-minded singer-songwriter tradition, with heart-on-sleeve lyrics and acoustic guitar-driven arrangements, the album brims with toe-tapping pop (first single 'Let's Just Fall In Love Again,' 'This Heart Of Mine'), strummy folk ('That's What I'm Here For,' the lilting 'If I Were You'), and electrifying rock ('Closer,' 'Heart of Stone') - all cleverly balanced with unabashedly emotional tunes like 'Love Uncompromised,' 'It Matters To Me,' 'You Can Always Come Home,' and a stunning version of Leonard Cohen's 'Hallelujah' (which Castro performed on Idol, citing Jeff Buckley's version as a huge inspiration to him as an artist).<br>To capture the moods he wanted, Castro collaborated with producer Eric Rosse (Sara Bareilles, Tori Amos) and a host of top-notch songwriters - including Marc Roberge of O.A.R., Gregg Wattenberg (Five For Fighting), Zac Maloy (David Cook), and Espionage (Train) - all of whom helped Castro create an earthy showcase for his considerable gifts as a vocalist, songwriter, and musician, not to mention the warmth and sincerity that shines through everything he does. 'I feel like the album really captures my personality,' Castro says. 'People got to know me a bit on the show, so I wanted to build on that by including all these songs I've written about my life. I wanted to share with people the things that are meaningful to me.', upload/1335971587.8.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, Jason Castro, 2010, 327, 0075678958403, Atlantic, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['Jason Castro', "With his rich tenor voice, distinctive looks, and endearingly innocent charm, Jason Castro won over millions of viewers as a contestant on the seventh season of American Idol, parlaying his substantial singer-songwriter appeal into a third-place runner-up finish. He may not have won the competition, but the 22-year-old Texan earned himself a devoted fan base eager to hear what he would do once freed to perform his own songs. Those folks will get their chance with the release of Castro's self-titled debut album on Atlantic Records.<br>Though rooted in the classic, melody-minded singer-songwriter tradition, with heart-on-sleeve lyrics and acoustic guitar-driven arrangements, the album brims with toe-tapping pop (first single 'Let's Just Fall In Love Again,' 'This Heart Of Mine'), strummy folk ('That's What I'm Here For,' the lilting 'If I Were You'), and electrifying rock ('Closer,' 'Heart of Stone') - all cleverly balanced with unabashedly emotional tunes like 'Love Uncompromised,' 'It Matters To Me,' 'You Can Always Come Home,' and a stunning version of Leonard Cohen's 'Hallelujah' (which Castro performed on Idol, citing Jeff Buckley's version as a huge inspiration to him as an artist).<br>To capture the moods he wanted, Castro collaborated with producer Eric Rosse (Sara Bareilles, Tori Amos) and a host of top-notch songwriters - including Marc Roberge of O.A.R., Gregg Wattenberg (Five For Fighting), Zac Maloy (David Cook), and Espionage (Train) - all of whom helped Castro create an earthy showcase for his considerable gifts as a vocalist, songwriter, and musician, not to mention the warmth and sincerity that shines through everything he does. 'I feel like the album really captures my personality,' Castro says. 'People got to know me a bit on the show, so I wanted to build on that by including all these songs I've written about my life. I wanted to share with people the things that are meaningful to me.'", u'upload/1335971587.8.jpg', True, u'100.00', True, 100, 'Jason Castro', 2010, 327, '0075678958403', 'Atlantic', u'2012-05-02', u'2012-05-02', 1]

2012-05-02 23:13:12,349 DEBUG (0.000) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (The Winter of Mixed Drinks, Frightened Rabbit’s steady ascent is set to rise incrementally with the release of the new album, appetite for which has been whetted by the anthemic ‘Swim Until You Can’t See Land’ teaser single which gave the band their first Zane Lowe plays and made a unaminous critcal impression at NME, Q, News Of The World, Record Of The Day, CMU Daily. More tellingly they registered strongly in the albums of the decade polls everywhere from blogs to NME and The Skinny.<br>Metophorically, lead single ‘Swim Until You Can’t See Land’ might have taken up where the band left off (‘Floating In The Forth’), but ‘The Winter Of Mixed Drinks’ showcases a more fully realised sound with a broader pallette, with direct and upbeat songs like (new single, 22nd Feb) ‘Nothing Like You’ and ‘Living In Colour’ jostling for position with intense and brittle epics like ‘Skip The Youth’ and ‘Yes I Would’. Speaking to nme.com at the end of last year, lead singer Scott Hutchison explained ‘We’ve broadened our horizons sonically and it feels like a natural move forward. Most importantly, it’s better than the last one.’ Produced once again by Peter Katis at Tarquin Studios in Connecticut, and engineered by Stuart Hamilton at Castlesound Studios in Scotland, ‘The Winter Of Mixed Drinks’ also boasts stunning string arrangements from labelmate, Teutonic ivory-botherer, Hauschka.<br>In order to facilitate the new material and flesh out the older tunes live, the band – once upon a time simply Scott alone – have recently expanded to a five piece with the addition of new member Gordon Skene (formerly of Make Model). ‘”We want to do the recordings justice when we play them live,” explains Scott. “Gordon will be playing a bundle of instruments – we just bought a tasty wee mandolin for him to fiddle!” Having toured the UK in November and December as support to Gomez and Modest Mouse (and the USA in September with labelmates The Twilight Sad and We Were Promised Jetpacks), the band have UK headline shows coming up in March.<br>After months on the road and a climatic sell-out show at the Scala in April 2009, Frightened Rabbit finally called a hiatus to touring, Hutchison decamping to the splendid – and beautiful – isolation afforded by the seaside town of Crail on the Fyfe coastline to write the material that would make up the new album. Perhaps because of this ‘The Winter Of Mixed Drinks’ is populated with nautical references in the same way that Midnight Organ Fight found expression through body metaphors.<br>Frightened Rabbit saw out 2009 playing to an 80,000-strong crowd at Edinburgh’s Hogmanay celebration and 2010 will be a pivotal year for the band, as Scott acknowledges: “I’ve never been in a position of being aware of an audience of any size that was waiting for our music until now. You have to be aware of it or else it’s totally selfish. Pressure sounds like a negative thing but it’s quite positive actually. It feels earned. Everything we have achieved has been earned. It would be disappointing if we didn’t become more popular because that’s got to be the goal for every new record. If it comes I think we are actually ready for it now.’, upload/1335971592.35.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, Frightened Rabbit, 2010, 328, 0600116998422, Fat Cat, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['The Winter of Mixed Drinks', 'Frightened Rabbit\xe2\x80\x99s steady ascent is set to rise incrementally with the release of the new album, appetite for which has been whetted by the anthemic \xe2\x80\x98Swim Until You Can\xe2\x80\x99t See Land\xe2\x80\x99 teaser single which gave the band their first Zane Lowe plays and made a unaminous critcal impression at NME, Q, News Of The World, Record Of The Day, CMU Daily. 2012-05-02 23:13:47,371 DEBUG (0.000) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (未来－ミライ－／もしかして, 「未来ーミライー」とＣＸ系「グータンヌーボ」のテーマソング「もしかして」の両曲Ａ面のシングル。「未来ーミライー」は初の亀田誠冶氏とのコラボレーションで完成されたパワフルなラブソング。<br>「君」と「僕」は違う人間だからこそ、向かい合っていこうという二人の未来を歌います！<br>「もしかして」は別れた彼氏のことを、本当はまだ好きなのに、彼に対して友達みたいに振舞っている自分にそれでいいのかな？？それでいいんだ、、と自問自答をしてしまっている福原本人の実体験からくる失恋ソングです。<br>カップリングにはデビュー前にリリースした幻のインディーズ盤「STEP☆OUT」に収録されていた「絶え間なく」とSTUDIO APARTMENTがリミックスした「未来ーミライー」を収録した豪華盤シングル！<br>【タイアップ】<br>■『もしかして』…フジテレビ「グータンヌーボ」テーマソング※4月～6月末★, upload/1335971627.37.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 福原美穂, 2010, 332, 4988009045191, SMR, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02 23:13:49,773 INFO 2009曲风获得成功
2012-05-02 23:13:49,773 INFO ean已得到
2012-05-02 23:13:49,773 INFO publisher已得到
2012-05-02 23:13:50,398 INFO 1335971630.38.jpg封面下载成功
2012-05-02 23:13:50,398 INFO 开始添加
2012-05-02 23:13:50,398 DEBUG (0.000) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Unbroken, About the Artist<br>Katharine McPhee warmly laughs as she confesses she's been in "artistic hiding" for the last few years. "It took me a long time to figure out where I wanted to go and be as an artist," she says. "I needed time to learn who I was as a musician." Once she discovered the answer, however, her path was sure and swift. On Unbroken, her Verve Records debut, listeners will discover a glorious side of McPhee previously untapped. Poignant, vital lyrics swell over full, lush melodies. McPhee's supple, clear voice, resonating with emotion and confidence, caresses each note on this collection of soon-to- be pop classics. Fans first met McPhee on Season Five of American Idol. The runner-up could seemingly sing any style of music, but especially mesmerized millions with her heart-stirring rendition of "Over the Rainbow." Her first solo album, which debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard Top 200 in early 2007, only hinted at the extent of her talent--not only as a singer but as a songwriter--that Unbroken reveals. Unlike that first effort, McPhee co-wrote the majority of the songs on Unbroken, collaborating with fellow singer/songwriters Paula Cole, Ingrid Michaelson and Rachael Yamagata. "This record is definitely more personal to me," McPhee says. "I have more stories to tell. It's more of an artistic look at me as a person. Coming from a reality show, it's hard to know the depth of somebody. This record gave me that opportunity to show that. That's what Verve wanted from me: to make a record I was proud of. It was a huge blessing to give me that." Her vocals also display a new vulnerability and maturity that make Unbroken compelling listening. "I think I finally learned to breathe," McPhee says, both literally and figuratively. "I'm grounded in my own body; my voice was grounded. Having a big voice, I had to realize that singing high notes didn't equal artistry. This is more about how I can interpret a song, the nuances of singing." While sounding utterly contemporary, McPhee also drew from the tremendous voices that have guided her throughout her life ranging from Nina Simone to Sarah McLachlan. "I wanted some older influences on here," she says. "My mom is a cabaret singer; I grew up with the Great American Songbook. That's why I know all the standards, but I always had a want and a need for pop music." McPhee began work on Unbroken in 2008. At the urging on Universal Music Group chairman Doug Morris, she traveled to Nashville several times to write with some of Music City's top songwriters. "It was a really great place for me to grow as a songwriter; see how it's done," she says. What emerged were tales of resilience, of being bowed but not broken by life's experiences. "There are a lot of dark stories. I see a lot of sadness in the world," she says with a shrug. "I don't always have a rosy picture of the world. That comes out in my music more than I would like it to." "How" faces taking charge in a suffocatingly dark time. "The lyric was just so meaningful in so many ways," McPhee says. "I had to be in a position where I said, `This is my life'." The devastating, string-laced ballad "Say Goodbye," received its premiere when McPhee appeared on CSI: New York. Written about the pain that precedes an inevitable break up, "Say Goodbye," is "the slit your wrist song," McPhee says. (CSI: New York isn't her only acting credit; McPhee has appeared on Ugly Betty, also co-starred in the 2008 hit The House Bunny and has a lead role in the upcoming feature film You May Not Kiss the Bride). McPhee makes the driving first single, "Had It All," written by Kara Dioguardi, Mitch Allan and David Hodges, completely her own. The tune's upbeat melodies contrast the often downbeat lyrics of someone who appears to have lost it all: "The song represents a lot of stuff in some of our lives, looking back to the past," she says. "We can feel like we maybe made mistakes, but it all works out." But McPhee is far from a gloom merchant. "Lifeline" is decidedly upbeat. "Surrender," co-written with Michaelson, is ultimately a self-affirming call to love yourself as much as others do. The breathtaking title track, written with Cole, features one of McPhee's most stirring performances about coming through troubling times scarred but stronger. McPhee paired with producer John Alagia, best known for his work with John Mayer, Dave Matthews Band and Jason Mraz, to record Unbroken in studios throughout Los Angeles. "Part of John's charm was that he's just such a blast to hang out with," she says. "His contribution was really bringing in the right musicians and taking the vision to the right level." Among the top-flight players on Unbroken are drummer Victor Indrizzo, pianists Patrice Rushen and Billy Childs and guitarist extraordinaire Paul Jackson, Jr. The album's sole cover is the bonus track, McPhee's sprightly version of Melanie's 1971 hit, "Brand New Key." "I'd never heard that song in my life," she says. "It's so weird and so cute. People who really know me know that I'm a weird funny girl. I thought it was cute and good to have another fun song on the record." Along with her musical rebirth comes a stunning physical change: McPhee recently transformed from a long-haired brunette to a sultry blonde. "I've never done anything crazy like this," she says. "I didn't think I would cut my hair off or go this blonde, but I'm going through changes. Searching for lyrics and meaning in the record just sort of forced me to examine inside and out.", upload/1335971630.38.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, Katharine McPhee, 2010, 29, 0602527131061, Verve Forecast, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['Unbroken', 'About the Artist<br>Katharine McPhee warmly laughs as she confesses she\'s been in "artistic hiding" for the last few years. "It took me a long time to figure out where I wanted to go and be as an artist," she says. "I needed time to learn who I was as a musician." Once she discovered the answer, however, her path was sure and swift. On Unbroken, her Verve Records debut, listeners will discover a glorious side of McPhee previously untapped. Poignant, vital lyrics swell over full, lush melodies. McPhee\'s supple, clear voice, resonating with emotion and confidence, caresses each note on this collection of soon-to- be pop classics. Fans first met McPhee on Season Five of American Idol. The runner-up could seemingly sing any style of music, but especially mesmerized millions with her heart-stirring rendition of "Over the Rainbow." Her first solo album, which debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard Top 200 in early 2007, only hinted at the extent of her talent--not only as a singer but as a songwriter--that Unbroken reveals. Unlike that first effort, McPhee co-wrote the majority of the songs on Unbroken, collaborating with fellow singer/songwriters Paula Cole, Ingrid Michaelson and Rachael Yamagata. "This record is definitely more personal to me," McPhee says. "I have more stories to tell. It\'s more of an artistic look at me as a person. Coming from a reality show, it\'s hard to know the depth of somebody. This record gave me that opportunity to show that. That\'s what Verve wanted from me: to make a record I was proud of. It was a huge blessing to give me that." Her vocals also display a new vulnerability and maturity that make Unbroken compelling listening. "I think I finally learned to breathe," McPhee says, both literally and figuratively. "I\'m grounded in my own body; my voice was grounded. Having a big voice, I had to realize that singing high notes didn\'t equal artistry. This is more about how I can interpret a song, the nuances of singing." While sounding utterly contemporary, McPhee also drew from the tremendous voices that have guided her throughout her life ranging from Nina Simone to Sarah McLachlan. "I wanted some older influences on here," she says. "My mom is a cabaret singer; I grew up with the Great American Songbook. That\'s why I know all the standards, but I always had a want and a need for pop music." McPhee began work on Unbroken in 2008. At the urging on Universal Music Group chairman Doug Morris, she traveled to Nashville several times to write with some of Music City\'s top songwriters. "It was a really great place for me to grow as a songwriter; see how it\'s done," she says. What emerged were tales of resilience, of being bowed but not broken by life\'s experiences. "There are a lot of dark stories. I see a lot of sadness in the world," she says with a shrug. "I don\'t always have a rosy picture of the world. That comes out in my music more than I would like it to." "How" faces taking charge in a suffocatingly dark time. "The lyric was just so meaningful in so many ways," McPhee says. "I had to be in a position where I said, `This is my life\'." The devastating, string-laced ballad "Say Goodbye," received its premiere when McPhee appeared on CSI: New York. Written about the pain that precedes an inevitable break up, "Say Goodbye," is "the slit your wrist song," McPhee says. (CSI: New York isn\'t her only acting credit; McPhee has appeared on Ugly Betty, also co-starred in the 2008 hit The House Bunny and has a lead role in the upcoming feature film You May Not Kiss the Bride). McPhee makes the driving first single, "Had It All," written by Kara Dioguardi, Mitch Allan and David Hodges, completely her own. The tune\'s upbeat melodies contrast the often downbeat lyrics of someone who appears to have lost it all: "The song represents a lot of stuff in some of our lives, looking back to the past," she says. "We can feel like we maybe made mistakes, but it all works out." But McPhee is far from a gloom merchant. "Lifeline" is decidedly upbeat. "Surrender," co-written with Michaelson, is ultimately a self-affirming call to love yourself as much as others do. The breathtaking title track, written with Cole, features one of McPhee\'s most stirring performances about coming through troubling times scarred but stronger. McPhee paired with producer John Alagia, best known for his work with John Mayer, Dave Matthews Band and Jason Mraz, to record Unbroken in studios throughout Los Angeles. "Part of John\'s charm was that he\'s just such a blast to hang out with," she says. "His contribution was really bringing in the right musicians and taking the vision to the right level." Among the top-flight players on Unbroken are drummer Victor Indrizzo, pianists Patrice Rushen and Billy Childs and guitarist extraordinaire Paul Jackson, Jr. The album\'s sole cover is the bonus track, McPhee\'s sprightly version of Melanie\'s 1971 hit, "Brand New Key." "I\'d never heard that song in my life," she says. "It\'s so weird and so cute. People who really know me know that I\'m a weird funny girl. I thought it was cute and good to have another fun song on the record." Along with her musical rebirth comes a stunning physical change: McPhee recently transformed from a long-haired brunette to a sultry blonde. "I\'ve never done anything crazy like this," she says. "I didn\'t think I would cut my hair off or go this blonde, but I\'m going through changes. Searching for lyrics and meaning in the record just sort of forced me to examine inside and out."', u'upload/1335971630.38.jpg', True, u'100.00', True, 100, 'Katharine McPhee', 2010, 29, '0602527131061', 'Verve Forecast', u'2012-05-02', u'2012-05-02', 1]

2012-05-02 23:14:53,983 DEBUG (0.000) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Everybody Wants to Be on TV, 2010 sophomore album from the British Popsters. Everybody Wants To Be On TV is testament to the perseverance of these three best friends from Harrow that booked their own shows in the local pub for 10 years before their big, deserving chance. The album opens on the first single, 'This Ain't A Love Song', a hugely powerful, soaring song and a strong example of Scouting For Girls' ambitious new sound. 'Little Miss Naughty' has already become a live favorite from its very first play, and crams more bouncing melodies into its three minutes than any number of established songwriters thought possible. 'Famous' is Scouting For Girls at their most unashamedly uptempo, a 'Video Killed The Radio Star' for the 21st Century, it's refrain of "we all want to be famous, we all want to be on TV' is an observation on a generation who cannot get enough of reality television and the urge of having the spotlight shine on them no matter what the consequences. 10 tracks. 2012-05-02 23:14:55,295 DEBUG (0.000) INSERT INTO "album_genre" ("name") VALUES (纯音乐); args=['\xe7\xba\xaf\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe4\xb9\x90']
2012-05-02 23:14:55,434 INFO 纯音乐曲风获得成功
2012-05-02 23:14:55,434 INFO ean已得到
2012-05-02 23:14:55,434 INFO publisher已得到
2012-05-02 23:14:55,871 INFO 1335971695.86.jpg封面下载成功
2012-05-02 23:14:55,871 INFO 开始添加
2012-05-02 23:14:55,871 DEBUG (0.000) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Vorleben, 现场录音专辑<br>It could be argued that Dustin O’Halloran epitomises the new generation of ‘classical’ and classically-inspired musician/composers of recent years. Favouring heart-wrenching melodies and floating structures over atonal experimentation and avant-garde deconstruction, O’Halloran’s music exists to blow the cobwebs from your seldom-touched heart-strings and pull on them with a gentle force that many contemporary composers have long forgotten.<br>Just as Philip Glass played his own compositions in the attics of New York in the late 60’s, O’Halloran too blurs the line between musician and composer by performing his works around the world. Whereas Glass chose this route because the usual concert venues were uninterested in his new style, O’Halloran has enjoyed great success in some of the worlds most prestigious venues such as the Guggenheim in New York and the Getty Museum in Los Angeles.<br>‘Vorleben’ was recorded in the Grunewald Church in Berlin – one of Dustin’s only concerts in the city since moving there in 2008. As well as fantastic acoustics and a beautiful setting, the Grunewald church has a piano with such a distinct character that some may already recognise from Nils Frahm’s Kning Disk album, ‘The Bells’. It was at the release party of ‘The Bells’ that this album was recorded, with Greg Haines and Anne Müller also taking to stage in support of their friend Nils. After touring constantly in 2008 with KD Lang, it was a chance for O’Halloran to present his refined live-set to his friends and fellow Berliners in an environment that perfectly suited the delicate and attentive nature of the music.<br>Although this is a live recording, you won’t hear any audience noise here. Rather than disrupt the tracks with the clattering of applause, each track appears as if from nowhere before gently dissolving into the next. In this sense, ‘Vorleben’ almost feels like a compilation of the greatest sections from O’Halloran’s Piano Solos Volume 1 (2004) and Volume 2 (2006), both released on the English Bella Union label. Someone acquainted with these albums will also notice two unreleased tracks; the opening track ‘Opus 54′ containing a poignancy often found on the ECM label, and the haunting ‘Prelude N. 3′, which brings to mind traces of Craig Armstrong and other modern film composers that tread the line between melancholy and romanticism. Other influences date further back: flickers of Bach appear in ‘Opus 17′, hints of Satie emerge throughout, ‘Opus 28′ even touches upon the Minimalist sound of the 70’s – but as was made clear by his past albums and his film music for Sofia Coppola’s Marie Antionette and William Ollson’s An American Affair, O’Halloran has genuinely nurtured a sound that could only be called his own.<br>Whether you have been waiting eagerly for new material from Dustin or are looking for an introduction into his work, ‘Vorleben’ is an album that will make a lasting impression on all those looking for heart-warming, introspective piano music that is as much memorable as it is refreshingly beautiful. – Sonic Pieces, upload/1335971695.86.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, Dustin O'Halloran, 2010, 333, tu10335370, sonicpieces, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); args=['Vorleben', '\xe7\x8e\xb0\xe5\x9c\xba\xe5\xbd\x95\xe9\x9f\xb3\xe4\xb8\x93\xe8\xbe\x91<br>It could be argued that Dustin O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran epitomises the new generation of \xe2\x80\x98classical\xe2\x80\x99 and classically-inspired musician/composers of recent years. Favouring heart-wrenching melodies and floating structures over atonal experimentation and avant-garde deconstruction, O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran\xe2\x80\x99s music exists to blow the cobwebs from your seldom-touched heart-strings and pull on them with a gentle force that many contemporary composers have long forgotten.<br>Just as Philip Glass played his own compositions in the attics of New York in the late 60\xe2\x80\x99s, O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran too blurs the line between musician and composer by performing his works around the world. Whereas Glass chose this route because the usual concert venues were uninterested in his new style, O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran has enjoyed great success in some of the worlds most prestigious venues such as the Guggenheim in New York and the Getty Museum in Los Angeles.<br>\xe2\x80\x98Vorleben\xe2\x80\x99 was recorded in the Grunewald Church in Berlin \xe2\x80\x93 one of Dustin\xe2\x80\x99s only concerts in the city since moving there in 2008. As well as fantastic acoustics and a beautiful setting, the Grunewald church has a piano with such a distinct character that some may already recognise from Nils Frahm\xe2\x80\x99s Kning Disk album, \xe2\x80\x98The Bells\xe2\x80\x99. It was at the release party of \xe2\x80\x98The Bells\xe2\x80\x99 that this album was recorded, with Greg Haines and Anne M\xc3\xbcller also taking to stage in support of their friend Nils. After touring constantly in 2008 with KD Lang, it was a chance for O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran to present his refined live-set to his friends and fellow Berliners in an environment that perfectly suited the delicate and attentive nature of the music.<br>Although this is a live recording, you won\xe2\x80\x99t hear any audience noise here. Rather than disrupt the tracks with the clattering of applause, each track appears as if from nowhere before gently dissolving into the next. In this sense, \xe2\x80\x98Vorleben\xe2\x80\x99 almost feels like a compilation of the greatest sections from O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran\xe2\x80\x99s Piano Solos Volume 1 (2004) and Volume 2 (2006), both released on the English Bella Union label. Someone acquainted with these albums will also notice two unreleased tracks; the opening track \xe2\x80\x98Opus 54\xe2\x80\xb2 containing a poignancy often found on the ECM label, and the haunting \xe2\x80\x98Prelude N. 3\xe2\x80\xb2, which brings to mind traces of Craig Armstrong and other modern film composers that tread the line between melancholy and romanticism. Other influences date further back: flickers of Bach appear in \xe2\x80\x98Opus 17\xe2\x80\xb2, hints of Satie emerge throughout, \xe2\x80\x98Opus 28\xe2\x80\xb2 even touches upon the Minimalist sound of the 70\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x93 but as was made clear by his past albums and his film music for Sofia Coppola\xe2\x80\x99s Marie Antionette and William Ollson\xe2\x80\x99s An American Affair, O\xe2\x80\x99Halloran has genuinely nurtured a sound that could only be called his own.<br>Whether you have been waiting eagerly for new material from Dustin or are looking for an introduction into his work, \xe2\x80\x98Vorleben\xe2\x80\x99 is an album that will make a lasting impression on all those looking for heart-warming, introspective piano music that is as much memorable as it is refreshingly beautiful. \xe2\x80\x93 Sonic Pieces', u'upload/1335971695.86.jpg', True, u'100.00', True, 100, "Dustin O'Halloran", 2010, 333, 'tu10335370', 'sonicpieces', u'2012-05-02', u'2012-05-02', 1]

2012-05-02 23:20:48,216 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (太阳, 限量精裝版<br>陳綺貞 2009全創作專輯 太陽<br>如此貼近生命 如此真實而自由<br>一個真誠而獨特的台灣歌手<br>一張陪伴一輩子的唱片<br>歷經三年沉澱反芻<br>獨立製作的典範<br>陳綺貞超越自我表白 、直指事物核心之作<br>展現藝術追求、回歸純我<br>重返創作現場的動人收音<br>花的三部曲 之二<br>太陽<br>由兩屆金曲獎得主鍾成虎操刀製作<br>葛萊美獎得主Bernie Grundman母帶後期處理<br>採用樂手全live同步錄製<br>勢必成為２００９樂迷熱烈討論的年度大碟<br>世界越來越快<br>我開始相信<br>我們從中尋找的 或許是永恆<br>那是一種巨大的愛<br>是你的靈魂，於眾人遺忘處<br>仍然奮力燃燒....<br>時常你覺得自己脆弱、渺小而不堪一擊<br>但你不知道，你或許已經是別人心中的　太陽<br>太陽是關於一個更深刻的自我<br>以及一些屬於我們的故事<br>這三年，陳綺貞認真生活<br>她獨立做唱片、獨立生活、自己做遠方的旅行並且體會自由。<br>她聽見很多人的快樂悲傷，<br>她蒐集了<br>十一首深刻的歌要告訴你一個動人的生命詩篇<br>關於追尋、關於愛與不朽<br>她小心翼翼地收起原本脆弱渺小的力量並且凝視，發現它們靜靜地綻放光芒。<br>綺貞說:<br>"希望這張專輯能讓孤單與憂傷的人獲得力量，讓快樂的人也願意分享。"<br>她做到了，如此真實而美好!<br>房間&重生&創作現場<br>奇特的是，這張專輯所有的配唱全在陳綺貞的家中錄製。<br>"動物受傷時，總會跑回自己的巢穴，舔舐傷口、修復自己"<br>每個人成長都曾面臨不安與恐懼。纖細敏感的綺貞習慣選擇在自己的房間安靜獨處，修復自己。<br>她在自己的房間中生活、讀書、思考，也將這些生活的痕跡寫在歌裡。<br>如今，這個房間成為這張唱片錄音的地點，作品重新回到了創作現場。<br>製作人鍾成虎說<br>"這些作品的傑出，讓我啞口無言..."，"於是我認真思考保存它們的方式。"<br>"用這樣的方式錄製，保有了作品原本的質感和情緒。結果令人非常滿意。"<br>錄音師攜帶大批精密的錄音器材在綺貞家中的各個角落幾經測試之後，決定將麥克風架設於衣櫥之中。<br>也許是因為每一件衣服都保有綺貞生活的記憶，這裡的聲音特別溫暖富有感情。<br>這也讓陳綺貞回歸最自我狀態的創作現場，每一首創作都宛如重生。<br>一個平凡的房間，一次敏銳細微的美麗聲響<br>不同於一般唱片制式的配唱限制，在自己熟悉的環境下，捕捉到更敏銳細微、只存留在日常生活中自然流露的各種情緒，<br>於是，就在這平凡的房間中，造就了這張動人的作品。<br>樂壇好手再度聚首全LIVE同步錄音，深具默契，真誠的超高水準製作<br>在樂器的方面更維持了陳綺貞唱片一貫的講究，沒有過多時下充斥的合成器音效。反而是更多的真實樂器。<br>所有基礎樂器伴奏都由樂手同步在鼓手陳柏州位於桃園的家中錄製完成。<br>貝斯 林羿妏/鼓手 陳柏州/吉他 鍾成虎/鍵盤 陳建騏/手風琴 王雁盟<br>要同時聽到他們的演出，一向只有在陳綺貞的唱片裡。<br>這群目前活耀於樂壇的重量級新生代好手再度聚首，專為陳綺貞人生中的第五張創作大碟盡情揮灑。精彩動人。<br>陳綺貞本人更負責了七首木吉他、一首手風琴以及兩首鋼琴伴奏。音符簡約聰慧而匠心獨具。<br>弦樂部分則遠赴北京錄製，由鍾興民以及李琪兩位資深音樂人操刀編寫及指揮，情感豐沛細膩。<br>並由最擅長發掘歌手特質的兩屆金曲獎得主鐘成虎擔綱製作，<br>不但讓成熟的作品被賦予完整的生命，同步錄音的配器與歌手演唱力度相輔相成，<br>更讓歌手充滿感情的聲音自由伸展、情緒完整並展現最真誠的時刻。<br>製作地點橫跨台灣、洛杉磯、北京 。品質精良、製作用心，堪稱2009流行樂壇巨作。<br>屬於陳綺貞式的藝術追求 花的三部曲 腐朽、重生、綻放<br>陳綺貞一直在思考一個完整的創作歷程 能象徵自己的生命歷程<br>"很希望用我自己的作品來記錄這個概念的誕生"<br>從2006開始 她終於思考出 花的姿態三部曲的概念<br>腐朽 重生 綻放 三個主題 華麗的冒險的專輯概念 和當時想要完成的概念 就是第一個歷程<br>接下來陳綺貞的唱片靈感都圍繞在 第二個歷程--重生 這個概念<br>"太陽"這個主題就是在這個狀況下誕生。<br>專輯中以兩支哲學式的單曲"太陽"和"魚"以天空和海洋先拉開了整張專輯的格局，<br>有趣的是這兩支單曲的名字也是從上張專輯中"腐朽"的歌詞裡擷取，<br>"重生來自於腐朽"陳綺貞如是說。"<br>關於陳綺貞<br>從一開始在墾丁賣demo開始，這位土生土長的台灣女生就沒有停止過夢想。<br>並且一直用作品刻畫著她獨特的生命。<br>在邊緣遊走的這幾年，陳綺貞難以被主流或非主流歸類，<br>反而讓她走出只有她能走的路，世界給予她充沛的能量，也創造了屬於自己的獨特風格 。<br>每隔2~3年才出一張唱片，<br>以商業思維來說也許太慢，但陳綺貞說:<br>"或許是世界太快了..."<br>從不受外界影響，她一直用她自己的步伐、她自己的姿態，書寫她的生命。<br>她用作品同步了生命，花的姿態這個主題正是她的思考，<br>從來不曾停止夢想也不改初衷，她將繼續寧靜向前<br>花的三部曲之二 太陽<br>這是陳綺貞的第五張作品，絕對值得您珍藏。<br>1/22 即將溫暖你的心房<br>太陽也許不知道自己多麼重要<br>或許 他只是個膽小鬼，如同你我一樣<br>預購贈品: 陳綺貞攝影作品明信片 一組<br>添翼創越工作室 溫暖發行<br>業務代理 艾迴唱片, upload/1335972048.2.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 陈绮贞, 2009, 29, 4719760090027, 艾迴, 2012-05-02, \xe6\x88\x96\xe8\xa8\xb1\xe6\x98\xaf\xe6\xb0\xb8\xe6\x81\x86<br>\xe9\x82\xa3\xe6\x98\xaf\xe4\xb8\x80\xe7\xa8\xae\xe5\xb7\xa8\xe5\xa4\xa7\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x84\x9b<br>\xe6\x98\xaf\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe7\x9a\x84\xe9\x9d\x88\xe9\xad\x82\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x96\xbc\xe7\x9c\xbe\xe4\xba\xba\xe9\x81\xba\xe5\xbf\x98\xe8\x99\x95<br>\xe4\xbb\x8d\xe7\x84\xb6\xe5\xa5\xae\xe5\x8a\x9b\xe7\x87\x83\xe7\x87\x92....<br>\xe6\x99\x82\xe5\xb8\xb8\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe8\xa6\xba\xe5\xbe\x97\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe8\x84\x86\xe5\xbc\xb1\xe3\x80\x81\xe6\xb8\xba\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe8\x80\x8c\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe5\xa0\xaa\xe4\xb8\x80\xe6\x93\x8a<br>\xe4\xbd\x86\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe7\x9f\xa5\xe9\x81\x93\xef\xbc\x8c\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe6\x88\x96\xe8\xa8\xb1\xe5\xb7\xb2\xe7\xb6\x93\xe6\x98\xaf\xe5\x88\xa5\xe4\xba\xba\xe5\xbf\x83\xe4\xb8\xad\xe7\x9a\x84\xe3\x80\x80\xe5\xa4\xaa\xe9\x99\xbd<br>\xe5\xa4\xaa\xe9\x99\xbd\xe6\x98\xaf\xe9\x97\x9c\xe6\x96\xbc\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe6\x9b\xb4\xe6\xb7\xb1\xe5\x88\xbb\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\x87\xaa\xe6\x88\x91<br>\xe4\xbb\xa5\xe5\x8f\x8a\xe4\xb8\x80\xe4\xba\x9b\xe5\xb1\xac\xe6\x96\xbc\xe6\x88\x91\xe5\x80\x91\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x95\x85\xe4\xba\x8b<br>\xe9\x80\x99\xe4\xb8\x89\xe5\xb9\xb4\xef\xbc\x8c\xe9\x99\xb3\xe7\xb6\xba\xe8\xb2\x9e\xe8\xaa\x8d\xe7\x9c\x9f\xe7\x94\x9f\xe6\xb4\xbb<br>\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe7\x8d\xa8\xe7\xab\x8b\xe5\x81\x9a\xe5\x94\xb1\xe7\x89\x87\xe3\x80\x81\xe7\x8d\xa8\xe7\xab\x8b\xe7\x94\x9f\xe6\xb4\xbb\xe3\x80\x81\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe5\x81\x9a\xe9\x81\xa0\xe6\x96\xb9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x97\x85\xe8\xa1\x8c\xe4\xb8\xa6\xe4\xb8\x94\xe9\xab\x94\xe6\x9c\x83\xe8\x87\xaa\xe7\x94\xb1\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe8\x81\xbd\xe8\xa6\x8b\xe5\xbe\x88\xe5\xa4\x9a\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xbf\xab\xe6\xa8\x82\xe6\x82\xb2\xe5\x82\xb7\xef\xbc\x8c<br>\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe8\x92\x90\xe9\x9b\x86\xe4\xba\x86<br>\xe5\x8d\x81\xe4\xb8\x80\xe9\xa6\x96\xe6\xb7\xb1\xe5\x88\xbb\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\xad\x8c\xe8\xa6\x81\xe5\x91\x8a\xe8\xa8\xb4\xe4\xbd\xa0\xe4\xb8\x80\xe5\x80\x8b\xe5\x8b\x95\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x9a\x84\xe7\x94\x9f\xe5\x91\xbd\xe8\xa9\xa9\xe7\xaf\x87<br>\xe9\x97\x9c\xe6\x96\xbc\xe8\xbf\xbd\xe5\xb0\x8b\xe3\x80\x81\xe9\x97\x9c\xe6\x96\xbc\xe6\x84\x9b\xe8\x88\x87\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe6\x9c\xbd<br>\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe5\xbf\x83\xe7\xbf\xbc\xe7\xbf\xbc\xe5\x9c\xb0\xe6\x94\xb6\xe8\xb5\xb7\xe5\x8e\x9f\xe6\x9c\xac\xe8\x84\x86\xe5\xbc\xb1\xe6\xb8\xba\xe5\xb0\x8f\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\x8a\x9b\xe9\x87\x8f\xe4\xb8\xa6\xe4\xb8\x94\xe5\x87\x9d\xe8\xa6\x96\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\x99\xbc\xe7\x8f\xbe\xe5\xae\x83\xe5\x80\x91\xe9\x9d\x9c\xe9\x9d\x9c\xe5\x9c\xb0\xe7\xb6\xbb\xe6\x94\xbe\xe5\x85\x89\xe8\x8a\x92\xe3\x80\x82<br>\xe7\xb6\xba\xe8\xb2\x9e\xe8\xaa\xaa:<br>"\xe5\xb8\x8c\xe6\x9c\x9b\xe9\x80\x99\xe5\xbc\xb5\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf\xe8\x83\xbd\xe8\xae\x93\xe5\xad\xa4\xe5\x96\xae\xe8\x88\x87\xe6\x86\x82\xe5\x82\xb7\xe7\x9a\x84\xe4\xba\xba\xe7\x8d\xb2\xe5\xbe\x97\xe5\x8a\x9b\xe9\x87\x8f\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\xae\x93\xe5\xbf\xab\xe6\xa8\x82\xe7\x9a\x84\xe4\xba\xba\xe4\xb9\x9f\xe9\xa1\x98\xe6\x84\x8f\xe5\x88\x86\xe4\xba\xab\xe3\x80\x82"<br>\xe5\xa5\xb9\xe5\x81\x9a\xe5\x88\xb0\xe4\xba\x86\xef\xbc\x8c\xe5\xa6\x82\xe6\xad\xa4\xe7\x9c\x9f\xe5\xaf\xa6\xe8\x80\x8c\xe7\xbe\x8e\xe5\xa5\xbd!<br>\xe6\x88\xbf\xe9\x96\x93&\xe9\x87\x8d\xe7\x94\x9f&\xe5\x89\xb5\xe4\xbd\x9c\xe7\x8f\xbe\xe5\xa0\xb4<br>\xe5\xa5\x87\xe7\x89\xb9\xe7\x9a\x84\xe6\x98\xaf\xef\xbc\x8c\xe9\x80\x99\xe5\xbc\xb5\xe5\xb0\x88\xe8\xbc\xaf\xe6\x89\x80\xe6\x9c\x89\xe7\x9a\x84\xe9\x85\x8d\xe5\x94\xb1\xe5\x85\xa8\xe5\x9c\xa8\xe9\x99\xb3\xe7\xb6\xba\xe8\xb2\x9e\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xae\xb6\xe4\xb8\xad\xe9\x8c\x84\xe8\xa3\xbd\xe3\x80\x82<br>"\xe5\x8b\x95\xe7\x89\xa9\xe5\x8f\x97\xe5\x82\xb7\xe6\x99\x82\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\xb8\xbd\xe6\x9c\x83\xe8\xb7\x91\xe5\x9b\x9e\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1\xe7\x9a\x84\xe5\xb7\xa2\xe7\xa9\xb4\xef\xbc\x8c\xe8\x88\x94\xe8\x88\x90\xe5\x82\xb7\xe5\x8f\xa3\xe3\x80\x81\xe4\xbf\xae\xe5\xbe\xa9\xe8\x87\xaa\xe5\xb7\xb1"<br>\xe6\xaf\x8f\xe5\x80\x8b\xe4\xba\xba\xe6\x88\x90\xe9\x95\xb7\xe9\x83\xbd\xe6\x9b\xbe\xe9\x9d\xa2\xe8\x87\xa8\xe4\xb8\x8d\xe5 "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (城市, 城市裡，愛的來臨當如是<br>所有浮生裡萬千的臉孔 ，讓我因你們而隆重<br>張懸 & Algae<br>四個人的力量　八個月的醞釀　十首歌的哼唱<br>一張 獻給 【城 市】的專輯<br>首波主打《Beautiful Woman》<br>在孤獨與美好的城市裡<br>讓我們一起擁抱，認同與愛的 大自由<br>【城 市】專輯概念<br>張懸 & Algae<br>四個人的力量　八個月的醞釀　十首歌的哼唱<br>一張 獻給 【城 市】的專輯<br>唱過溫暖人心的《寶貝》<br>也因為時光流逝寫下了《喜歡》<br>張懸第三張全創作專輯【城 市】，以「城市」為創作概念<br>用十首歌曲，把眼光還給你（妳）生命中的所有風景！<br>《Beautiful Woman》<br>老是被賦予嚴肅的性別認同議題，張懸＆Algae用輕快搖滾曲風，唱著城市裡應該追逐的"認同與愛"的大自由。<br>《Selling》<br>重新填上中文歌詞，以簡單直接的字句說出城市中矛盾複雜的慾望追逐。在Algae全新編曲之後，張懸特有的口述式唱腔成了最大的驚喜。<br>《城市》<br>用歌詞描繪成的一幅風景畫。有城市中毫不掩飾暴露的現實，而張懸卻用她的眼光，塗上屬於她最浪漫自由的色彩！聽完你（妳）會發現，臉上始終帶著一抹被鼓舞之後的笑容。<br>「我時常感覺〝城〞中實體的建設，<br>其中人群聚集流動形成的〝市〞集，<br>交織無限的，我們抽象的感官經驗與思考 。」─張懸<br>我們在城市漫步流浪、又在城市落地生根 ;<br>我們在城市嬉戲玩笑、也在城市感受悲傷 ;<br>我們在城市裡追求、卻同樣在城市中失落…<br>如果你（妳）也認同「城市」散發出去的一切真實，那麼在多變的時代你（妳）更應該聽聽張懸！<br>【 屬於Algae 眼中的城市 】<br>「在這個巨大的城市裡，我們很難去隱藏所有情感，<br>就像這張專輯中，總會找到一首屬於自己的主題曲。」─杉特<br>「台北，既熟悉又陌生的城市。<br>嚴格講起來我不算「住」在台北，反而比較像寄居蟹一樣從這個殼流動到另一個殼，唯一不同之處是寄居蟹的選擇還比我多一些。每隔一段時間便重覆地打包、搬運、拆封、整理……，在城市裡（間）流動的生活讓我覺得自己不屬於任何一地，不屬於台北，同時也因離開太久的陌生感而不屬於自己的故鄉台中。這張專輯某種程度上反映了這種游離的狀態。」─凱同<br>「我喜歡自由的漫步在城市中，以及靜靜看著城市裡的人們，藉此聆聽城市裡多樣的聲音。在這張【城 市】裡頭，有我們對音樂的執著與這些日子的感受，有值得歡欣鼓掌慶祝的，也有日後仍需努力進步的，但希望未來的哪一天有很多人一起聽這樣的聲音。」─雞毛, upload/1335972048.99.jpg, True, 100.00, True, 100, 张悬, 2009, 266, 0886975329120, 索尼音樂, 2012-05-02, 2012-05-02, 1); 2012-05-02 23:20:59,946 INFO 开始添加
2012-05-02 23:20:59,950 DEBUG (0.002) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (春·日光, 让歌迷们期待，第五张专辑《春．日光》乃苏打绿「韦瓦第计画」的第一波。韦瓦第为18世纪初古协奏曲之父，苏打绿从《无与伦比的美丽》中「四季狂想」这首歌而萌芽了「韦瓦第计画」，以春、夏、秋、冬四季为主题，2009年起预计在两年内发行四张专辑，来呈现四个季节、四个城市、四种情绪和四张专辑，包括∶属于台东春天的温暖民谣、台东夏天的热情摇滚、北京秋天的忧伤诗歌、冬天柏林的庄严古典，并将于5月中将展开一连串校园演唱和9月19日在小巨蛋办演唱会，进行跨国性的突破音乐演出。<br>《春．日光》中12首精彩的新歌，乃苏打绿从多年来苏打绿大量从未发表过的的创作作品中挑选出适合的主题歌曲，经重新编写后，并集结成表达出春天概念的全新专辑。为了迎合了春天的气息，专辑的音乐作品极具复古味，带来了新鲜感。这次的专辑以世界民谣风为特色，台湾最顶尖的打击乐手李守信(小白)，演奏各地乐器，让歌迷们体验异国情调。12首精彩的新歌有既静又动的主打歌「日光」、咏物诗「交响梦」、庄周梦蝶谱上旋律的「各站停靠」和温暖的小品「早点回家」。<br>预购版加送「日光」单曲CD。, "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (上五楼的快活, 台湾金曲歌王陈奕迅首次挑战台语歌，在2009年全新国语专辑《上五楼的快活》中演绎首支台语歌「我甲你」，由乱弹乐团主唱阿翔创作。此外，碟内亦多方邀请创作歌手写歌，有蔡健雅的「多少」、苏打绿青峰的「这样的一个麻烦」、范晓萱的「你为什麽哭了呢」、小安的「心的距离」，而Eason也特别创作了一首新歌「给你」，呼吁珍惜地球的环保讯息。整张专辑主打「快活」主义，无论在选歌及演绎上，制作人林暐哲让Eason可以自在地透过音乐记录生活。<br>随碟限量加送「陈奕迅五楼demo笔记本」，当中有由Eason亲自拍摄的写真手札(72页)，以及他在录音室live band试唱的纪念版CD(11曲)。<br>快乐还不够 要快活才可以<br>给你陈奕迅 上五楼的快活<br>Eason Chan陈奕迅<br>全新国语专辑 “上五楼的快活”<br>超值限量预购赠品: 陈奕迅五楼demo笔记本<br>1. 72页写真手札【陈奕迅亲自拍摄】<br>2. 11曲试唱短版CD【陈奕迅录音室live band试唱纪念版】, upload/1335972061.17.jpg, 2012-05-02 23:21:04,944 DEBUG (0.001) INSERT INTO "album_album" ("title", "description", "pic", "for_sale", "price", "active", "amount", "singer", "year", "genre_id", "isbn", "company", "create_date", "modify_date", "store_id") VALUES (Timeless 可啦思刻, 有些歌 是一輩子的, 無論什麼時候出現, 都是新歌o<br>男孩在自己的房間，拿起吉他，上了弦<br>他溫柔而緩慢地調著這把老吉他，專心的像是世上只有這件事情可以做<br>一首熟悉的歌慢慢在心中，如輕煙裊裊升起<br>他彈起了前奏，又唱了兩句，然後像是想起什麼似的………<br>原來 這些歌曲<br>聯繫著過往和現在的自己<br>在時空中交錯著的<br>是我們了然於胸的擁抱<br>方大同 2009自選輯~Timeless:《可啦思刻》<br>有些歌 是一輩子的, 無論什麼時候出現, 都是新歌o<br>想必你會問方大同：<br>“為什麼會錄製這張翻唱作品呢？”<br>這個問題，其實是另一個問題的答案：<br>“是什麼啟發了你的音樂創作？”<br>2005年出道至今，四張全創作專輯銷售與口碑一致受到肯定，不斷持續在音樂世界裡，燃燒狂熱的創作力。創作動聽，唱腔獨特，而近來唱片圈稱許為”唱作靈魂音樂小教父”，備受矚目的方大同，下一步會是…？<br>每每發片，總引起各界好奇的想問方大同當初是什麼開啟了他的音樂創作大門？… 想要挖掘方大同熱愛音樂與誘發創作的源頭…<br>3歲半的自主<br>在父母親的影響下，生在一個多元音樂的環境中長大，3歲半的方大同就已經在聽歌，並且懂得選自己喜歡的歌聽，慢慢的也開始喜歡買自己想聽的歌曲卡帶。他非常明白，他耳朵蒐集到的這些音樂，是他學習音樂最剛開始的過程。<br>5歲的深刻<br>5歲時，看過一部關於音樂人的傳記電影【LAMBA】，開始了他對音樂與舞台表演濃厚的興趣。那麼小年紀的孩子，卻有這番自主和深刻，也許是天份使然，這一切他竟然全部都記得!!!<br>早在2005年，方大同曾在腦中閃過一個念頭…有可能某個時刻他會製作一張屬於自己的翻唱自選輯。一部有關於方大同成長意義的自選輯，讓自己永遠記得回歸起點，看見自己在每一個當下被音樂牽引的感動。<br>雖然聽著舊音樂，腦子裡轉的卻是新的編曲，當代的情境，這些歌曲等於經過他的體內又重新被整理了一次。他不時哼唱著這些歌曲，隨著旋律的流轉變化，興起他對音樂世界的無比熱情，和勇敢想像的信念。<br>方大同在這次的自選輯裡，收錄了10首好好聽的歌曲，這些旋律在無形之中影響了他的生活，陪伴他的成長，為他的背景添上色彩，給予他音樂創作的養分。<br>因為真心喜歡這些歌曲，並且每一首都挾帶著一篇成長的小故事，對方大同來說，重新詮釋這些歌曲，不時有種不可忽視的情感在；明顯感到和面對自己創作時的心情不大相同，但同樣都覺得好玩有玩出興味來。<br>入選的10首曲目，每首歌都有一篇專屬於方大同和歌曲之間，成長過程的專屬內心故事。專輯首波率先主打單曲：【紅豆】，在大同11幾歲重回上海，這個孩提時候成長的地方，發現當時身邊的朋友都很喜歡在K歌房點唱這首歌，幾乎是大合唱!!!所以這首【紅豆】的旋律令他感到很有懷念的氣氛。<br>好的旋律不因時間而改變<br>透過他的聲音 「於是我感覺到完整，和我的赤子在一起，分享著100%的生活。<br>我找到解藥，那就是愛的擁抱，不容妥協，也不會被打敗，我感到完整，這份力量讓我繼續向前。<br>「前進一點，就又會有希望，這就是活著的爽！」每個人與他的赤子如此約定。<br>盤腿坐在沙發上，有時候我唱，有時候赤子唱，這些歌分享內心滿滿的快樂與希望。」<br>這張專輯，從 剖析、自嘲、憤怒、甚至幽默的意識形態裡，帶著復古情懷性格，唱出甜美的現代寓言。<br>萱萱+100%樂團，裝扮著70復古，內藏雌雄同體的中性靈魂，引領你喚回一個沒有性別、赤真赤誠，你遺忘已久的自己─赤子。<br>70年代濃縮著他們的童年，直至成人，70年代留下的影像、音樂、氣氛，流在血和靈魂裡；曾深深的被迷幻搖滾吸引，萱萱卻對木匠兄妹主唱Karen
